DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ADEQ BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ADEQ WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, ADEQ WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO REACH OUT TO RURAL COMMUNITIES AND PROVIDE INFORMATION ON BROWNFIELDS FUNDING AT THE FEDERAL AND STATE LEVEL, ATTEND OUTREACH EVENTS AND GIVE PRESENTATIONS TO LOCAL COMMUNITIES. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $700,000. SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES:ADEQ WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE BY ADMINISTERING FUNDS TO CONDUCT PHASE I AND II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS (ESA), ASBESTOS AND LEAD-BASED PAINT SURVEYS AND ABATEMENT ACTIVITIES. FURTHERMORE, ADEQ WILL PREPARE SAPS FOR PHASE II ESAS AND SUBMIT THEM TO THE EPA FOR SIMULTANEOUS REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO BEGINNING SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ADEQ WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE ADEQ VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS MULTIPLE SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF UP TO THREE SITES, DEVELOP MAPS, PICTURES, AND UPDATES FOR WEB PAGES AS WELL AS SITE COORDINATES AND MAPS FOR DATABASE AND ADEQ ONLINE EMAP.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF HAWAII'S DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH HAZARD EVALUATION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE (HEER) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. HEER WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW HEER TO EXPAND HEER'S STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM (SRP) BROWNFIELD INVENTORY BY IDENTIFYING SPECIFIC UST SITES AND ANY SOLID WASTE SITES WITH KNOWN OR SUSPECTED CONTAMINATION, INCLUDING PETROLEUM, THAT QUALIFY FOR THE STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM AND HAVE REDEVELOPMENT POTENTIAL.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $383,700.  PREAWARD COST ARE APPROVED BACK TO OCTOBER 1, 2022.ACTIVITIES:HEER WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

THIS GROWING CAPABILITY WILL ENSURE RAPID, HIGH PRIORITY REVIEW OF THREATS TO DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES AND SUPPORT AMERICA'S WATER INFRASTRUCTURE ACT (AWIA) SECTION 2018 SPILL NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS THAT COMMUNITY WATER SYSTEMS (1) RECEIVE EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION OF ANY REPORTABLE RELEASE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE THAT POTENTIALLY AFFECTS THEIR SOURCE WATER, AND (2) HAVE ACCESS TO TIER II INFORMATION. CONDUCT ANALYSIS OF RELEASES THAT OCCUR OVER OR NEAR DRINKING WATER WELLS OR SOURCE WATER AND ADD MAPPED SYSTEM FEATURES TO IHEER
FOR INTERNAL ACCESS, WITH IMMEDIATE TRIGGER IF A RELEASE HAPPENS NEAR A DRINKING WATER SOURCE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:HEER'S STATEWIDE BROWNFIELD INVENTORY WILL BE EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ADDITIONAL CANDIDATE SITES REGULATED UNDER OTHER DOH PROGRAMS, THAT MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE. THESE SITES WILL BE VISIBLE AND TAGGED AS BROWNFIELDS IN IHEER. ADDITIONALLY THERE WILL BE EFFECTIVE IC MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM FOR CONTAMINATED SITES PRIOR TO REMEDIATION, DURING CONSTRUCTION, AND AFTER CLOSEOUT WITH NFA WITH ICS THAT ARE COVERED BY EHMPS. ENSURE PROTECTION OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH ENHANCED SOIL EXPORT MONITORING WHILE ALLOWING BENEFICIAL AND SAFE REUSE OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES, AVOIDING UNNECESSARY USE OF VERY LIMITED LANDFILL SPACE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF CA DEPARTMENT OF TOXIC SUBSTANCES CONTROL (CADTSC) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. CADTSC WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE MULTIPLE LEVELS OF GOALS RANGING FROM SHORT-LONG, SUCH AS CREATING CROSS-PROGRAM SYNERGIES SUCH THAT THE COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS USING THESE FUNDING AND RESOURCES ARE ABLE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF A STEPPINGSTONE APPROACH AND USE MULTIPLE SOURCES OF FUNDING TO ALLEVIATE POLLUTIONS BURDENS AND REVITALIZE COMMUNITY SPACES FOR MAXIM BENEFIT OF THOSE WHO LIVE, WORK, LEARN AND PLAY IN THE AREAS.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 10/01/2022. ACTIVITIES:CADTSC WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW CADTSC TO ESTABLISH AN INTER-AGENCY WORKING WITH STATE AGENCIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND HOUSING JUSTICE ADVOCACY GROUPS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CADTSC'S SITE MITIGATION AND RESTORATION PROGRAM OFFICE OF BROWNFIELDS, TO WHICH THESE SECTION 128(A) FUNDS ARE APPLIED, FOCUSES ON THE MAINTENANCE AND ENHANCEMENT OF CADTSC'S BROWNFIELD INFRASTRUCTURE SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT AND FACILITATE THE SAFE USE AND REUSE OF UNDERUTILIZED PROPERTIES THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA. ALTHOUGH THE SECTION 128(A) FUNDS ARE FOCUSED ON INCREASING PRODUCTIVITY OF THE VOLUNTARY AGREEMENTS (DTSC'S PRIMARY TOOL TO SUPPORT PARTIES VOLUNTARILY ADDRESSING CONTAMINATION TO ADDRESS USE OR REUSE) THE TOOLS AND ENHANCEMENTS DEVELOPED WITH SECTION 128(A) FUNDS ARE BE USED TO ENHANCE OTHER DTSC SITE MITIGATION AND RESTORATION PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, RESOURCES FROM VARIOUS SUPPORT PROGRAMS SUCH AS THE GEOLOGICAL SERVICES BRANCH, THE HUMAN AND ECOLOGICAL RISK OFFICE, PUBLIC PARTICIPATION PROGRAM, THE OFFICE OF ENVIRONMENTAL EQUITY, AND THE GRANTS AND PROGRAM SUPPORT BRANCH ARE USED TO ENHANCE THE CORE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE DTSC SITE MITIGATION AND RESTORATION PROGRAM.

IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ARIZONA'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (ADEQ) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ADEQ WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE THROUGH ASSISTING. ADDITIONALLY, ADEQ WILL SUPERVISE AND MANAGE THE RESPONSE PROGRAM BY CONDUCTING DAILY CHECK-IN MEETINGS AND REGULAR BI#8208;WEEKLY ONE-ON-ONE MEETINGS TO DISCUSS THE BROWNFIELDS AND VOLUNTARY PROGRAMS STATUS WITH STAFF AND ASSISTING WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDING PUBLIC NOTIFICATIONS, MEDIA ADVISORIES, GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) MAPS, UPDATING THE ADEQ WEBSITE, DOCUMENTING SUCCESS STORIES, DETERMINING NO FURTHER ACTION DETERMINATIONS, PROCESSING DECLARATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL USE RESTRICTIONS (DEURS), PROBLEM SOLVING AND MANAGING THE FUNDING FOR THE PROJECTS AND BUDGETS. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: 'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.' NDEP WILL ASSIST THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS BY IDENTIFYING, INVENTORYING AND MAPPING BROWNFIELDS SITES IN THE RAFAEL RIVERA NEIGHBORHOOD, A HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $690,000.
ACTIVITIES:NDEP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEVADA. NDEP WILL ASSIST LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, TRIBES AND COMMUNITIES WITH PREPARING BROWNFIELDS SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT AND REVITALIZATION; CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH TO INFORM ELIGIBLE ENTITIES ABOUT BROWNFIELDS SUPPORT OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH NDEP'S BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM; MAINTAIN A 24-HOUR SPILL REPORTING HOTLINE AND OVERSEE NEVADA'S SPILL RESPONSE PROGRAM; CONDUCT BROWNFIELDS SITE ELIGIBILITY EVALUATIONS FOR ALL SITES PROPOSED FOR ACTIVITIES UNDER NEVADA'S BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM AND UNDER EPA'S COMPETITIVE BROWNFIELDS GRANTS (CERCLA 104K); AND CONDUCT STATE RESPONSE PLANNING ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING UPDATING GEOGRAPHIC RESPONSE PLANS AND CONDUCTING TABLE TOP EXERCISES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:NDEP WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE NEVADA BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES; COMPLETE PHASE I ASSESSMENTS FOR FIVE SITES AND PHASE II ASSESSMENTS FOR TWO SITES THROUGH THE NEVADA BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM ON BEHALF OF COMMUNITIES AND TRIBES; OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES AS REQUIRED; MAINTAIN THE STATE'S 24 HOUR SPILL HOTLINE AND COORDINATE SPILL RESPONSE; UPDATE GEOGRAPHIC RESPONSE PLANS; AND ASSIST THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS WITH IDENTIFYING, INVENTORYING, AND MAPPING BROWNFIELDS SITES WITHIN THE RAFAEL RIVERA NEIGHBORHOOD.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE NAVAJO NATION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE NAVAJO NATION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S LAND BASE. OVERALL GOAL OF THIS BIL 128(A) FUNDING WORKPLAN IS TO SUPPLEMENT THE NAVAJO NATION BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM'S EXISTING 128(A) ACTIVITIES. THE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM WILL EXPAND THEIR MISSION TO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP, AND POTENTIAL REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES AND OTHER SITES WITH ACTUAL OR PERCEIVED CONTAMINATION. THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST THE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM BY PROVIDING ADDITIONAL STAFF AND NEEDED VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT TO MEET PROGRAM EXPANSION NEEDS INCLUDING TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR STAFF AS APPROPRIATE. THIS GRANT FUNDING WILL BE USED TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORYING OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONCEPTUAL SITE MODELS, THE CREATION OF REMEDIATION PLANS FOR BROWNFIELD SITES INCLUDING INCORPORATING COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, CULMINATING IN A FULL ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP PLANNING FOR THE NAVAJO FOREST PRODUCTS INDUSTRY (NFPI) SITE AND INVESTIGATIONS AND ASSESSMENTS WORKING TOWARDS A FULL ASSESSMENT OF THE NAVAJO TRIBAL SAWMILL ENTERPRISE (NTSE) SITE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO 10/1/22.ACTIVITIES:YUROK WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, YUROK WILL IDENTIFY AND COMPLETE AT LEAST ONE TECHNICAL TRAINING ON ENVIRONMENTAL CRIMES, INVESTIGATION AND ENFORCEMENT. SPECIFIC FOCUS WILL BE ON ILLEGAL DUMP SITES AND ILLEGAL MARIJUANA CULTIVATION SITES IDENTIFIED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT AS POTENTIALLY CONTAMINATED AS A RESULT OF ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES, TRESPASSING, PESTICIDE AND RODENTICIDE USE, HAZARDOUS AND SOLID WASTE.

ADDITIONALLY, YUROK WILL HIRE AN ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIALIST TO DEVELOP A DATABASE OF ILLEGAL CANNABIS CULTIVATION SITES AND PRIORITIZATION LIST AND COORDINATE WITH THE YUROK FISHERIES DEPARTMENT FOR LIGHT DETECTION AND RANGING (LIDAR) DRONE SUPPORT.

THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES' BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS.  THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF IOWA, WITH CONTINUED FOCUS ON SMALL/RURAL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.ACTIVITIES:THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES.  PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ALSO INCLUDE OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; AND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS FOR CLEANUP COSTS ARE PLANNED, ON A COST-SHARE AND REIMBURSEMENT BASIS, UP TO $25,000 PER PROJECT AND UP TO 75% COST SHARE, TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES SUCH AS LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND NON-PROFITS, IN MOSTLY SMALL, RURAL, AND/OR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.OUTCOMES: THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF ITS BROWNFIELD REDEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAMS TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 8-10 SITES, REDUCE COSTS TO SUBAWARD COMMUNITIES BY INCREASING UP TO 75% THE RESPONSE PROGRAM SHARE OF SUBAWARD CLEANUP COSTS AND COVERING A PORTION OF VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM ENROLLEES' REQUIRED CLEANUP OVERSIGHT FEES, AND ESTABLISH A PROGRAMMING FRAMEWORK FOR WEB-BASED DATABASE INTEGRATION ENHANCEMENTS THAT WILL IMPROVE THE EASE OF ACCESS BY MORE COMMUNITIES TO CROSS-PROGRAM ENVIRONMENTAL PUBLIC RECORDS AND ENVIRONMENTAL DATABASES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. SUPPORT THE JUSTICE40 INITIATIVE, SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN RURAL AND SUBURBAN MISSOURI WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES.ACTIVITIES:MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AS A MEANS TO ACHIEVING REDEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVING THE LIVES OF  MISSOURI CITIZENS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS 25 SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS.  NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. OUTREACH TO COMMUNITIES LACKING CAPACITY TO ACCESS FEDERAL FUNDS IS A PRIORITY. ACTIVITIES:NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND TO IMPROVE AND UPDATE OUTREACH MATERIALS TO REFLECT THE NEW AGENCY NAME AND ADDRESS THE DIVERSITY OF THE STATE COMMUNITIES.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE DEPLOYED TO REIMBURSE CLEANUP COSTS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES. THE ASBESTOS, LEAD-BASED PAINT, AND MOLD CLEANUP COST SHARE PROGRAM IS REIMBURSED AT 50% OF TOTAL COST AND CAPPED AT $20,000 EACH. NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY MAY ALSO PROVIDE SUB-AWARDS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES FOR CLEANUP PLANNING OR ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP. PREFERENCE FOR SUB-AWARDS FOR ENVIRONMENTAL CLEANUP WILL BE TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES THAT COMPLETE CLEANUP UNDER THE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM. SUB-AWARDS TO REIMBURSE UP TO $15,000 FOR ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO PROCURE A CONTRACTOR TO ASSIST WITH BROWNFIELDS SITE VISIONING/MARKET ANALYSIS OR BROWNFIELDS FUNDING/FINANCING WILL ASSIST UP TO 2-3 ELIGIBLE ENTITIES.OUTCOMES:NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE NEBRASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND ENERGY VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS 45 SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 10 SITES, UPDATE A PROGRAM BROCHURE AND DEVELOP AND PROCURE A DISPLAY THAT CAN BE TAKEN TO IN-PERSON OUTREACH EVENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT'S (KDHE) RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; AND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF KANSAS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE RECIPIENT AS WELL AS KANSAS RESIDENTS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  THIS BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) FUNDED PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE STATE TO CARRY OUT SECTION 128(A) ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING BUILDING RESPONSE PROGRAM CAPACITY, OVERSEE BROWNFIELDS CLEANUPS, AND CONDUCT SITE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES OTHERWISE NOT ADDRESSED BY TRADITIONAL 128(A) FUNDING.ACTIVITIES:THE BIL 128(A) FUNDING WILL ENSURE THAT KDHE CAN ENHANCE AND FULFILL THE VISION AND MISSION BY ACHIEVING A GOAL OF ADDRESSING AND REMEDIATING CONTAMINATION OTHERWISE NOT ADDRESSED WITH TRADITIONAL FUNDING AND PROMOTING REDEVELOPMENT FOR ECONOMIC IMPROVEMENT IN UNDERSERVED AREAS.  ADDITIONALLY, KDHE WILL PERFORM FIVE ASBESTOS CONTAINING MATERIAL (ACM) CLEANUPS; DEVELOP AND PRIORITIZE A UNIVERSE OF ELIGIBLE SITES WITH ABANDONED UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (UST) FOR REMOVAL; AND CREATE AND PROVIDE DATA TO THE PUBLIC THAT WILL ASSIST IN ENSURING HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT ARE PROTECTED.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (KDHE) WILL UPDATE AND EXPAND THEIR CURRENT BROWNFIELDS INVENTORY; CONDUCT AT LEAST 5 ACM CLEANUPS; DEVELOP AND PRIORITIZE AN INVENTORY OF ELIGIBLE UST SITES FOR REMOVAL; AND PURCHASE A GEOPROBE TOOL FOR IDENTIFYING AND DOCUMENTING THE PRESENCE OF CONTAMINATION IN SOIL, GROUNDWATER, AND VAPOR.

DIRECT BENEFICIARY INCLUDES TRIBAL MEMBERS, THE VILLAGE OF SANTEE NEBRASKA AND OTHER RESIDENTS OF THE RESERVATION THAT MIGHT BE SERVED BY REDEVELOPMENT.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (PADEP) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS.  PADEP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF PA. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES. ' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: 'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION. THE PROJECT WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF PADEP'S VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM (VCP) TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.ACTIVITIES:PADEP WILL CONDUCT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: PERFORM TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES; PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; PROVIDE RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; AND PROVIDE MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:PADEP WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE PAPDEP VCP TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND OVERSEE THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF SITES THAT ARE NAVIGATING THE PADEP VCP. THE APPLICANT WILL ALSO PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE ELIGIBLE COMMUNITIES WHO WILL PROVIDE AND IMPLEMENT ASSISTANCE TO FACILITATE AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, ESTABLISH, ENHANCE, AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM, AND CONDUCT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENTS. OVERALL THIS ASSISTANCE WILL HELP ESTABLISH AND/OR ENHANCE A BROWNFIELD PROGRAM AT THE LOCAL LEVEL.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF OREGON DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY  (ODEQ) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ODEQ WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.  THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.  ODEQ WILL ALSO WORK WITH SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO ASSIST WITH BROWNFIELD CONCERNS.
ACTIVITIES:
ODEQ WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  ODEQ WILL ALSO MAKE A POINT OF WORKING WITH SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THEIR BROWNFIELD CONCERNS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ODEQ WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE OREGON VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS NUMEROUS SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF NUMEROUS SITES.

IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. FINALLY, THE AGREEMENT INCLUDES DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ELIGIBLE COMMUNITIES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE STATE OF IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S BROWNFIELDS STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE IDAHO DEQ WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF IDAHO.ACTIVITIES:THE IDAHO DEQ WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE GOAL OF THE IDEQ RESPONSE PROGRAM IS TO FACILITATE REUSE OF RESPONSE SITES BY INVENTORYING, ASSESSING AND REMEDIATING SITES (OR ASSISTING OTHER BROWNFIELD STAKEHOLDERS WITH THESE TASKS) IN A STREAMLINED AND COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER WITH IDAHO DEQ OVERSIGHT AND TO PROVIDE A MECHANISM BY WHICH PROPERTIES ARE MADE READY FOR REDEVELOPMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DURING THE 2022-2024 COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE IDAHO DEQ RESPONSE PROGRAM WILL CONDUCT SITE SPECIFIC ASSESSMENTS AT MANY ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELD PROPERTIES; COORDINATE WITH OTHER IDAHO DEQ WASTE AND REMEDIATION PROGRAMS TO STRATEGIZE NEXT STEPS FOR WASTE SITES; PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AND OVERSIGHT FOR EPA 104(K) BROWNFIELD GRANT APPLICANTS AND GRANTEES; PROVIDE OVERSIGHT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR IDAHO DEQ VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM (VCP) SITES; PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL COVENANT INSPECTION, TRACKING, AND OVERSIGHT; CONTINUE WITH INVENTORY EFFORTS; WORK WITH COMMUNITIES TO MOVE INVENTORIED BROWNFIELD SITES INTO REDEVELOPMENT; CONDUCT STATEWIDE OUTREACH TO BROWNFIELD STAKEHOLDERS; EXPAND EFFORTS TO COLLECT RETURN ON INVESTMENT METRICS FOR 128(A) AND 104(K) ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP SITES; AND, CONTINUE TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC NOTIFICATION OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.
THIS AWARD PROVIDES $863,329 OF FY2022 ALLOCATED FUNDS FOR YEAR 1 (2022-23) AND $439,071 IN FORWARD FUNDING FOR YEAR 2 (2023-24) FOR A TOTAL OF $1,302,400 IN INCREMENTAL FUNDING OF THE TOTAL APPROVED BUDGET AND PROJECT PERIOD COSTS OF $1,798,378 FOR THE 2 YEAR PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ROSEBUD'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, TARGETED BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION.ACTIVITIES:ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE ROSEBUD SIOUX TRIBE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE RESERVATION, ASSESS 1-3 SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 1-3 SITES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF [NAME OF GRANTEE'S] BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE AND SIOUX TRIBES WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC OUTREACH, ENHANCEMENT OF BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM THROUGH TRAINING AND EQUIPMENT UPDATES, CLEANUP VERIFICATION AND DOCUMENT REVIEW, AND CONDUCTING SITE CLEANUPS AND INVESTIGATIONS.ACTIVITIES:FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE AND SIOUX TRIBES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC OUTREACH, ENHANCEMENT OF BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM THROUGH TRAINING AND EQUIPMENT UPDATES, CLEANUP VERIFICATION AND DOCUMENT REVIEW, INVESTIGATION OF DUMP SITES AND POTENTIAL PETROLEUM SITES, AND CONDUCTING SITE CLEANUPS FOR APPROXIMATELY 18 RESIDENTIAL SITES AND AT LEAST ONE COMMERCIAL PROPERTY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE AND SIOUX TRIBES WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE AND SIOUX TRIBES VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING HOSTING FOUR PUBLIC MEETINGS AND PRODUCING A BROCHURE AND FACT SHEETS. FORT PECK ASSINIBOINE AND SIOUX TRIBES WILL REDUCE NEGATIVE IMPACTS OF CONTAMINATION TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT BY INVESTIGATING DUMP SITES AND POTENTIAL PETROLEUM SITES, OVERSEEING THE CLEANUP OF METHAMPHETAMINE AND ASBESTOS ABATEMENT IN 18 RESIDENCES, AND OVERSEEING THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF AT LEAST ONE COMMERCIAL SITE. THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING FOR STAFF IN HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MANAGEMENT, ASBESTOS, BROWNFIELD CLEANUP TECHNOLOGIES, AND OTHER BROWNFIELD TOPICS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF FORT BELKNAP'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE FORT BELKNAP COMMUNITY COUNCIL WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.. THE SPECIFIC FOCUS OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE TO TO DIGITIZE, ORGANIZE, AND CENTRALIZE ENVIRONMENTAL DEPARTMENT FILES, MODERNIZE AND IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF THE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM, ENHANCE CAPACITY BY TRAINING STAFF, ENHANCE EXISTING REGULATIONS, AND CONDUCT SEVERAL HAZARDOUS MATERIALS ABATEMENT PROJECTS.ACTIVITIES:THE FORT BELKNAP COMMUNITY COUNCIL WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ENHANCED RECORDKEEPING, UPDATING REGULATIONS, CONDUCTING UP TO 16 ASBESTOS ABATEMENTS, AND PROVIDING TRAINING FOR STAFF IN HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MANAGEMENT WILL ALL BE CONDUCTED USING THE FUNDS PROVIDED IN THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE FORT BELKNAP COMMUNITY COUNCIL WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE FORT BELKNAP VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, UPDATE HAZARDOUS WASTE CODES, DIGITIZE BROWNFIELDS AND SOLID WASTE RECORDS, PROVIDE TRAINING FOR UP TO 16 STAFF IN HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MANAGEMENT, AND ABATE ASBESTOS IN UP TO 16 STRUCTURES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE FLANDREAU SANTEE  SIOUX TRIBE (FSST) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE FSST WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THIS FUNDING REQUEST DOES NOT DUPLICATE ANY PREVIOUS BROWNFIELDS WORK ALREADY FUNDED BY THE ANNUAL APPROPRIATION ALLOCATION FOR FLANDREAU SANTEE SIOUX TRIBE TO EXECUTE ITS PROGRAM. INSTEAD, THE REQUEST IS A PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT TO FURTHER DEVELOP ENFORCEMENT PROCEDURES FOR THE NEWLY ADOPTED SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE CODE AND PLAN FOR THE POLICE, FIRE, HOUSING, AND NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENTAL MANAGERS FOR A COORDINATED AND EFFECTIVE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SECTION 128(A) TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:FSST WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  TASK 1 IS FLOWCHART- REVIEW CODES AND PLANS TO IDENTIFY THE ACTION POINTS FOR ENFORCEMENT, DEVELOP DRAFT AND TASK 2) TRAINING AND MATERIALS-  COMPLETE FINAL FLOW CHART AS WELL AS PREPARE TRAINING MATERIALS INCLUDING PREPARING THE CHART FOR TRAINING, REVIEW THE FLOW CHART, PREPARE DRAFT AND FINAL TRAINING MATERIALS, CONDUCT TRAINING FOR ALL ENFORCEMENT PROCEDURES. TASK 3 IS BROWNFIELDS CHAPTER 5 SOP UPDATE WHICH ENTAILS REVIEW MATERIALS FROM THE CODE, 
PLAN, FLOW CHART, AND TRAINING AND WRITE THE DRAFT AND FINAL CHAPTER FOR THE SOP, CALLED ENFORCEMENT TRAINING.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: FSST WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE THEIR VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES  THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM FROM THE OUTPUTS OF TASK 1)-  A REFERABLE SOURCE FOR PROCEDURE ENFORCEMENT AND ESTABLISHING A WELL-EXECUTED FLOW CHART TO BETTER EQUIP PERSONNEL. TASK 2) TRAINING AND MATERIALS-- FLOW CHART WITH THE MOST RECENT PROCEDURES AND PROTOCOLS FOR BROWNFIELDS AND PRESENTING UNDERSTANDABLE MATERIALS FOR PERSONNEL USE, PERSONNEL EQUIPPED WITH 
REFERENCE MATERIAL AND KNOWLEDGE OF ENFORCEABLE PROCEDURES, IMPROVED REGULATIONS OF ENFORCEMENT PROCEDURES.  TASK 3) - CREATING A COMPREHENSIVE OUTLINE FOR THE NEW CHAPTER AND THE EXPANSION OF CHAPTER 5 IN THE SOP,  AN IMPROVED REVIEW SOURCE FOR THE ENFORCEMENT TRAINING OF PERSONNEL.

THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE:  'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.' THE MONTANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL CONDUCT OUTREACH TO SUPPORT STATEWIDE BROWNFIELD PROGRAM PARTICIPATION, UPDATE REGULATIONS THAT APPLY TO BROWNFIELDS REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES, AND CONDUCT ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES AT ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MONTANA.

MONTANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL ALSO OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF ALL BROWNFIELD REMEDIATION CLEANUPS IN THE STATE OF MONTANA AS THE REGULATORY AUTHORITY FOR PROVIDING NO FURTHER ACTION LETTERS WHICH MAY OR MAY NOT INCLUDE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ENGINEERING AND/OR INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS.

IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. SPECIFICALLY, THE ACTIVITIES WILL ENHANCE THE FOUR BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM ELEMENTS, ENHANCE THE RESPONSE PROGRAM AND CLEANUP CAPACITY, AND SITE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE PROVIDED TO 4 SEPARATE COMMUNITIES TO ASSIST IN THE IDENTIFICATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES AND INCLUDING THE SITES ON THE STATE BROWNFIELD INVENTORY. OUTCOMES: CDPHE WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE CDPHE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS SITES THROUGH THE STATE INVOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM. CDPHE'S VCUP TYPICALLY HAS WAITING LISTS OF SITES AND THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW THEM TO PROCESS THE BACKLOG OF SITES ANTICIPATED OVER 15 PROPERTIES. THIS BIL FUNDING IS BEING USED TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF THE EXISTING VCUP PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF LAC DU FLAMBEAU BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA INDIANS' BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. LAC DU FLAMBEAU WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL RESERVATION. 

ACTIVITIES:LAC DU FLAMBEAU  WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL RESERVATION.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LAC DU FLAMBEAU WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF LAC DU FLAMBEAU'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM IN SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS SITES THROUGH THEIR RESPONSE PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES AND TAKE PROGRESSIVE STEPS TOWARD RESPONSE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT THAT RESPONDS TO COMMUNITY AND GOVERNMENT CONCERNS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WDNR) REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. WDNR WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING AND PROGRAM CAPACITY ENHANCEMENT OF BROWNFIELDS WORK THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: 'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.' WDNR WILL UTILIZE 128(A) FUNDS TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS OF MANAGING THE RR PROGRAM, ADMINISTER THE STATE'S BROWNFIELDS INITIATIVES, AND ENHANCE PUBLIC RECORD. 

ACTIVITIES:WDNR REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

THE DNR PLANS TO USE THE GRANT TO ADMINISTER THE VOLUNTARY PARTY LIABILITY EXEMPTION (VPLE) CLEANUP PROGRAM AND THE WISCONSIN PLANT RECOVERY INITIATIVE, AS WELL AS TO ENHANCE THE PUBLIC RECORD BY CONTINUING THE DIGITIZATION AND UPLOAD OF THE OVER 80,000 PAPER RECORDS RELATED TO CONTAMINATED SITES. LASTLY, THESE FUNDS WILL AID IN DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING SPECIFIC EPA COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS AND EVALUATING PROGRESS ON MEASURING THE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH THOSE AGREEMENTS. FOR EXAMPLE, BY COVERING A PORTION OF THE ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH IMPLEMENTING THE WISCONSIN DNR'S BROWNFIELDS REVOLVING LOAN FUND CALLED THE READY FOR REUSE PROGRAM AND THE EPA BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT GRANTS, INCLUDING THE WISCONSIN ASSESSMENT MONIES (WAM) PROGRAM, AS WELL AS EFFORTS TO ENHANCE THESE PROGRAMS AND CONDUCT OUTREACH TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS.

THE STATE OF WISCONSIN WILL CONDUCT WORK PURSUANT TO SECTION 128(A) OF CERCLA TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND ENHANCEMENT OF ITS STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (WISCONSIN DNR) ADMINISTERS WISCONSIN&RSQUOANDS STATE COMPREHENSIVE RESPONSE PROGRAM, WHICH IS THE SUBJECT OF THIS GRANT. THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS UNDER THE JURISDICTION OF WISCONSIN DNR&RSQUOANDS REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT (RR) PROGRAM, INCLUDING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUST), SUPERFUND, RCRA HAZARDOUS WASTE CLOSURES AND CORRECTIVE ACTIONS, AND STATE ENFORCEMENT AND VOLUNTARY CLEANUP ACTIONS UNDER THE STATE&RSQUOANDS COMPREHENSIVE SPILL LAW.

WISCONSIN DNR&RSQUOANDS CONTAMINATED LAND INITIATIVE HAS THREE MAIN &LDQUOANDOUTCOMES&RDQUOAND IDENTIFIED BY THE RR PROGRAM. THESE OUTCOMES ARE: 1. THE RR PROGRAM STAFF WILL BE RESPONSIVE TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINATION CAUSED BY DISCHARGES OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES AND IMPACTS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION. 2. THE RR PROGRAM&RSQUOANDS ACTIONS WILL BE PROTECTIVE OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT FROM DISCHARGES OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES AND IMPACTS FROM ENVIRONMENTAL POLLUTION. 3. THE RR PROGRAM&RSQUOANDS ACTIVITIES WILL IMPROVE THE ECONOMIC VIABILITY OF COMMUNITIES BY REVITALIZING CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION'S (VADEQ) TO PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL AND/OR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES THROUGH STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) AUTHORIZES A TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANT ('TAG') PROGRAM TO FUND ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.'  THIS AGREEMENT WILL ENABLE VADEQ TO RAISE AWARENESS OF THE FEDERAL/STATE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS TO FACILITATE POCAHONTAS ISLAND WHICH IS A PENINSULA TO PETERSBURGH VA.  THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPILE ONE FINAL REPORT ALONG WITH FOUR QUARTERLY REPORTS. THE RECIPIENT WILL RAISE THEIR AWARENESS TOWARDS BROWNFIELDS CAPACITY BUILDING AND DEVELOP AN INVENTORY OF POTENTIAL BROWNFIELD SITES BY CONDUCTING UP TO THREE MEETINGS WITH LOCAL OFFICIALS OF POCAHONTAS ISLAND.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: 'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION. ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THOSE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS AT THE LOCAL LEVEL.  VADEQ WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES THAT MAY INCLUDE COMMUNITY VISIONING AND MARKET ANALYSIS THAT ADVANCES CLEANUP AND REUSE OF BROWNFIELDS SITES WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA.  VADEQ MAY ASSIST LOCAL GOVERNMENTS WITH GIVING THEM AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE VADEQ VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM (VCP) AND MAY DESIGN CHARRETTE FOR SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT WITH THEIR BROWNFIELDS PROJECTS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE GRANTEE AS WELL AS STATE RESIDENTS THROUGH FUTURE CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT OF IDENTIFIED SITES, AND THE COMMUNITIES THAT RECEIVE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. SUBSTANTIAL FEDERAL INVOLVEMENT INCLUDES PROGRAMMATIC OVERSIGHT, AND REVIEW AND COMMENT OF ALL AGREEMENT ACTIVITIES AND PRODUCTS, AS IDENTIFIED IN THE WORK PLAN.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S RESPONSE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ELIGIBLE COMMUNITIES TO IMPLEMENT ITS OWN PROJECT.  ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THOSE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS AT THE LOCAL LEVEL.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE'S RESPONSE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRIBAL MEMBERS OF THE AKWESASNE BROWNFIELDS COMMITTEE, ABC, THROUGH TAILORED MEETINGS AIMED TO PRESENT INFORMATION ON LOCAL BROWNFIELD PROJECTS, CONDUCT SITE VISITS WITH THE ABC GROUP, AND TO FURTHER DEVELOP A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROCESS FOR INCORPORATING TRIBAL MEMBERS' INTEREST AND PRIORITIES INTO SITE REDEVELOPMENT PLANS.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES' RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

DESCRIPTION:THE GOALS OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE TO SUPPORT THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE (LLBO) TRIBE TO CONTINUE BUILDING ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128(A), AND TO ASSIST THE LLBO TRIBE IN REMEDIATING, REDEVELOPING AND REUSING POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS AND CONTAMINATED SITES, KNOWN AS BROWNFIELDS SITES, THROUGHOUT THE LLBO RESERVATION. IN ADDITION, THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE LLBO TRIBE AS THEY EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF LLBO'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITHIN THEIR RESERVATION. ACTIVITIES: THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE (LLBO) TRIBE WILL PERFORM A TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, AS THE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF THESE PROPERTIES MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. THE LLBO TRIBE WILL WORK WITH THE CITY OF CASS LAKE IN ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELD SITES WHILE ALSO PERFORMING COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELD SITES WITHIN THE LLBO RESERVATION AND THE CONTINUED EXPANSION OF LLBO'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE.

IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENTAND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE AND PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE&RSQUOANDS JURISDICTION, TO DEVELOP THEIR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM BY DEVELOPING THE FOUR ELEMENTS AND BUILD CAPACITY FOR TRIBAL PROGRAM AND STAFF. ACTIVITIES TO BE IMPLEMENTED WITH TIMELINES AND DELIVERABLES: ASSESS AND CLEANUP SITES IN A STREAMLINED AND COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE LEECH LAKE BAND OF OJIBWE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  SPECIFICALLY, THE STATE WILL UPDATE AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, CONDUCT TARGETED BROWNFIELDS SITE ASSESSMENTS, AND ENHANCE THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL RESULT IN INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS, SPECIFICALLY CLEANING UP AND PUTTING BACK INTO USE CONTAMINATED SITES. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF NEW JERSEY. THEY INCLUDE A BROAD RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS (E.G., TRIBAL, STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER NON-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES.ACTIVITIES:NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL UTILIZE THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128(A) FUNDS TO AUGMENT THE STATE'S CURRENT RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCORPORATES THE FOUR ELEMENTS PRIORITIZED BY EPA: 1) TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, 2) OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES, 3) MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, AND 4) MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS AND CERTIFICATION THAT CLEANUP IS COMPLETE.  

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES.  THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO MAINTAIN THE EXISTING RESPONSE PROGRAM, TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM, TO USE LINKED DATA PROGRAMS FOR THE CREATION OF A COMPREHENSIVE INVENTORY OF THE STATE'S BROWNFIELD SITES, TO CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE LIST OF THE STATE'S BROWNFIELD SITES THAT ARE IN DESIGNATED COMMUNITY COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVE COMMUNITIES AND OTHER COMMUNITIES, TO CONDUCT AN ECONOMIC IMPACT ANALYSIS ON COMPLETED BROWNFIELD PROJECTS, TO HEAVILY ASSIST WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NEW JERSEY'S ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE LAW, AND TO CONTINUE WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DATABASE THAT CAPTURES SUCCESS STORIES AND INFORMATION FROM COMPLETED REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT PROJECTS SO THAT TANGIBLE OUTCOMES OF CLEANUPS CAN BE DEMONSTRATED TO THE DEPARTMENT AND THE PUBLIC. THE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR OUTREACH AND EDUCATION SO THE PUBLIC CAN LEARN MORE ABOUT THE PROGRAMS WITHIN THE OFFICE OF BROWNFIELDS AND COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY IMPACTED BY BROWNFIELDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGH THE EXPANSION OF THE STATE'S CURRENT RESPONSE PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THE STATE WILL PERFORM AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, CONDUCT TARGETED BROWNFIELDS SITE ASSESSMENTS, AND ENHANCE THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL RESULT IN INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS, SPECIFICALLY CLEANING UP AND PUTTING BACK INTO USE CONTAMINATED SITES.  THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION'S (NYSDEC'S) DIVISION  OF ENVIRONMENTAL REMEDIATION (DER) UTILIZES A DATABASE TO MAINTAIN PROGRAM AND SITE-SPECIFIC INFORMATION AND STATISTICS FOR THE STATE'S REMEDIAL PROGRAMS. THE REMEDIAL PROGRESS OF SITE-SPECIFIC REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES (E.G., REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION (RI), REMEDIAL DESIGN (RD), REMEDIAL ACTION (RA), SITE MANAGEMENT (SM)) ARE TRACKED IN THAT DATABASE. THE DATABASE SYSTEM IS REFERRED TO AS THE UNIFIED INFORMATION SYSTEM (UIS) WHICH SERVES AS AN INVENTORY OF SITES IN THE STATE'S VARIOUS REMEDIAL PROGRAMS.ACTIVITIES:THE NEW YORK DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION WILL PERFORM AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, CONDUCT TARGETED BROWNFIELDS SITE ASSESSMENTS, AND ENHANCE THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM. A GOAL OF THE BROWNFIELD PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP PROGRAM (BCP) AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL REMEDIATION PROGRAM (ERP), IS THE REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE OF REAL PROPERTIES THAT HAVE THE PRESENCE OF CONTAMINANTS. THE (DER) PROVIDES SOME LEVEL OF OVERSIGHT FOR ALL REMEDIAL SITES IMPLEMENTED UNDER THE BROWNFIELD PROGRAMS TO ENSURE THE REMEDIES WILL BE PROTECTIVE OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPROPRIATE LAWS, REGULATIONS AND GUIDANCE. PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: ADDRESSING THE ENVIRONMENTAL, LEGAL AND FINANCIAL BARRIERS THAT OFTEN HINDER THE REDEVELOPMENT AND REUSE OF CONTAMINATED BROWNFIELD SITES,  MAINTAINING A SITE AND PROGRAM DATABASE THAT CONTAINS INFORMATION FOR SITES BEING ADDRESSED UNDER ONE OF THE FOLLOWING STATE REMEDIAL PROGRAMS: INACTIVE HAZARDOUS WASTE DISPOSAL SITE REMEDIAL PROGRAM, ALSO KNOWN AS STATE SUPERFUND PROGRAM (SSF); BROWNFIELD CLEANUP PROGRAM (BCP); AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESTORATION PROGRAM (ERP), AND  PROVIDING SOME LEVEL OF OVERSIGHT FOR ALL REMEDIAL SITES IMPLEMENTED UNDER THE BROWNFIELD PROGRAMS TO ENSURE THE REMEDIES WILL BE PROTECTIVE OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AND CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPROPRIATE LAWS, REGULATIONS AND GUIDANCE.  NYSDEC WILL CONTINUE TO CONDUCT BROWNFIELD OUTREACH EFFORTS IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES AND ENTITIES.  NYSDEC IMPLEMENTS THE SITE MANAGEMENT PLAN (SMP) AND ISSUES A CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION (COC) THAT ADDRESSES ANY REQUIRED INSTITUTIONAL AND ENGINEERING CONTROLS AND ENVIRONMENTAL EASEMENTS. THAT INFORMATION IS ALSO MAINTAINED IN THE ELECTRONIC DATABASE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE NYSDEC PLANS TO INCREASE CAPACITY OF THE 128(A) ASSESSMENT PROGRAM. THIS INCLUDES MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE WORK FORCE TO MEET WORK PLAN COMMITMENTS AND IMPROVE STAFF TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE AND PROVIDE FOR GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT.  THE PROGRAM WILL ENSURE REMEDIAL DECISIONS ARE PROTECTIVE OF PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  THE NYSDEC WILL IMPROVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND KNOWLEDGE OF BROWNFIELD PROGRAM AND INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.  THIS INCLUDES IMPROVING THE UNDERSTANDING AND PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAM ACTIVITIES AND INCREASING THE AWARENESS OF FUNDING AVAILABILITY.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES (DNER) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. DNER WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, MEETINGS AND ASSESSMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT PUERTO RICO.ACTIVITIES:DNER PROPOSES ACTIVITIES FOCUSED ON THE FOUR ELEMENTS OF A RESPONSE PROGRAM ENUMERATED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A). THESE FOUR ELEMENTS ARE: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES; MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION; AND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLAN AND VERIFICATION AND CERTIFICATION THAT CLEANUP IS COMPLETE. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT PUERTO RICO. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DNER WILL EXPAND ITS PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CAPACITY BUILDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRDNER'S STAFF AND STAKEHOLDERS, WHICH WILL THEN STRENGTHEN ITS RESPONSE PROGRAM AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH MUNICIPALITIES AND COMMUNITY BASED ORGANIZATIONS ALIKE. IN ADDITION, APPROXIMATELY 15 ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE PERFORMED BY A QUALIFIED CONTRACTOR. SITE SELECTION WILL BE CONSULTED WITH EPA REGION 2.

THAT INFORMATION IS ALSO MAINTAINED IN THE ELECTRONIC DATABASE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ST. REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ST. REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL NATION. TRIBE WILL FOCUS ON REMEDIATION AT 2 SITES BY CONDUCTING SITE SPECIFIC INVESTIGATIONS AND SUPPLEMENTAL ASSESSMENTS AS NEEDED. ACTIVITIES:ST. REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT AND THESE FUNDS ARE TO PERFORM PHASE I AND PHASE II SITE INVESTIGATIONS, CREATE AN ANALYSIS OF BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVE AND SUPPORT STAFF FOR ABANDONED STRUCTURES WORK AND OUTREACH. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ST. REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE AKWESASNE COMMUNITY. MONTHLY MEETINGS WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH THE AKWESASNE BROWNFIELD COMMITTEE. ADVERTISEMENT AND BROCHURES WILL BE CREATED AND DISTRIBUTED AS NEEDED. PHASE I AND PHASE II SITE INVESTIGATIONS REPORTS WILL BE DEVELOPED ALONG WITH THE ANALYSIS OF THE BROWNFIELD CLEANUP ALTERNATIVE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS.  THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS.  THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.   THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. SPECIFICALLY, THE STATE WILL UPDATE AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, CONDUCT TARGETED BROWNFIELDS SITE ASSESSMENTS, AND ENHANCE THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL RESULT IN INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS, SPECIFICALLY CLEANING UP AND PUTTING BACK INTO USE CONTAMINATED SITES. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF NEW JERSEY. THEY INCLUDE A BROAD RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS (E.G., TRIBAL, STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER NON-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES.)ACTIVITIES:NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL UTILIZE THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128(A) FUNDS TO AUGMENT THE STATE'S CURRENT RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCORPORATES THE FOUR ELEMENTS PRIORITIZED BY EPA: 1) TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, 2) OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES, 3) MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, AND 4) MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS AND CERTIFICATION THAT CLEANUP IS COMPLETE
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES. THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO MAINTAIN THE EXISTING RESPONSE PROGRAM, TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM, TO USE LINKED DATA PROGRAMS FOR THE CREATION OF A COMPREHENSIVE INVENTORY OF THE STATE'S BROWNFIELD SITES, TO CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE LIST OF THE STATE'S BROWNFIELD SITES THAT ARE IN DESIGNATED COMMUNITY COLLABORATIVE INITIATIVE COMMUNITIES AND OTHER COMMUNITIES, TO CONDUCT AN ECONOMIC IMPACT ANALYSIS ON COMPLETED BROWNFIELD PROJECTS, TO HEAVILY ASSIST WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NEW JERSEY'S ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE LAW, AND TO CONTINUE WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DATABASE THAT CAPTURES SUCCESS STORIES AND INFORMATION FROM COMPLETED REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT PROJECTS SO THAT TANGIBLE OUTCOMES OF CLEANUPS CAN BE DEMONSTRATED TO THE DEPARTMENT AND THE PUBLIC. THE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED FOR OUTREACH AND EDUCATION SO THE PUBLIC CAN LEARN MORE ABOUT THE PROGRAMS WITHIN THE OFFICE OF BROWNFIELDS AND COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY IMPACTED BY BROWNFIELDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF BRISTOL BAY NATIVE ASSOCIATION'S (BBNA) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. BBNA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR TRADITIONAL TRIBAL LANDS.
ACTIVITIES:BBNA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:BBNA WILL CONTINUE TO INVESTIGATE REPORTED SITES AND UPDATE THE SITE INVENTORY, PUBLIC RECORD, AND PRIORITIZED SITES LIST; COORDINATE WITH PARTNER AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO CONTINUE TO PROGRESS ON ADDRESSING BROWNFIELDS SITES; MEET WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND PROVIDE OUTREACH MATERIALS TO INFORM TRIBAL MEMBERS ABOUT THE PROGRAM, AS WELL AS PRESENT INFORMATION AT TRIBAL COUNCIL MEETINGS; REVIEW SITE CLOSURE RECOMMENDATIONS TO ENSURE PUBLIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL SAFETY.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS.
