DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF YUKON RIVER INTER-TRIBAL WATERSHED COUNCIL'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. YRITWC WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE U.S. PORTIONS OF THE YUKON RIVER WATERSHED.
ACTIVITIES:YRITWC WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE YRITWC 128(A) TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM IS TO INVENTORY AND CATALOG ALL CONTAMINATED SITES AMONG THE PARTICIPATING COMMUNITIES THAT LIE WITHIN THE ALASKA PORTION OF THE WATERSHED, PRIORITIZE THEIR LEVEL OF SEVERITY, AND INITIATE AND SUPPORT ASSESSMENT ALONG WITH CLEANUP ACTIVITIES FOR THE HIGHEST PRIORITY SITES THAT MEET THE EPA DEFINITION OF A 'BROWNFIELD.'

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:YRITWC WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO 44 PARTICIPATING COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND ASSESS 4 SITES THROUGH THE INTERTRIBAL CONSORTIUM'S TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  [THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND INCREASE IN HOUSE CAPACITY AND CONDUCT PLANNING AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE INDIAN RESERVATION. THE SPECIFIC FOCUS OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE: TO CONDUCT IN-HOUSE TRAINING FOR STAFF; DEVELOP A BROWNFIELDS WEBSITE TO ENHANCE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND A MATRIX TOOL TO PRIORITIZE SITES FOR CLEANUP; AND TO CONDUCT SEVERAL HAZARDOUS MATERIALS ABATEMENT PROJECTS.ACTIVITIES:NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: DEVELOP AT LEAST ONE BUILDING CODE; DEVELOP A DEDICATED BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM WEBPAGE THAT WILL LINK TO THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM'S WEBPAGE; DEVELOP A PRIORITIZATION MATRIX TOOL FOR SELECTING SITES FOR CLEAN UP; PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL IN HOUSE TRAINING FOR BROWNFIELDS STAFF AND WILL MAKE THE TRAINING AVAILABLE TO OTHER TRIBAL PROGRAMS TO ENHANCE COLLABORATION AND INCREASE AWARENESS; HIRE A NEW TECHNICIAN AND PURCHASE LAPTOP FOR NEW TECHNICIAN; HIRE A CONTRACTOR TO DEVELOP CLEAN-UP PLANS AND CONDUCT CLEAN UP ON 8 SITES.  THE CONTAMINANTS OF CONCERN INCLUDE PETROLEUM IN SOIL, AND LEAD AND ASBESTOS IN SOILS AND/OR BUILDING MATERIALS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NORTHERN CHEYENNE'S TRIBE'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LAND. SPECIFICALLY, NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL DEVELOP A PRIORITIZATION MATRIX TOOL TO PRIORITIZE CONTAMINATED SITES, AND OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF APPROXIMATELY 8 SITES INCLUDING 4 RESIDENTIAL SITES INCREASING THE HOUSING SUPPLY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS OF THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE INDIAN RESERVATION. THE STAFF OF THE NORTHERN CHEYENNE BROWNFIELDS TEAM WILL INCREASE IN-HOUSE CAPACITY BY THE HIRE OF A TECHNICIAN AND PROVIDING SUBSTANTIAL IN-HOUSE TRAINING FOR THEIR TEAM ON ASBESTOS ABATEMENT ASSESSMENT AWARENESS.  NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL INCREASE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND COLLABORATION BY THE DEVELOPMENT OF A DEDICATED BROWNFIELDS WEBPAGE AND BY OPENING THEIR IN-HOUSE TRAINING TO THE HOUSING AUTHORITY AND OTHER TRIBAL PROGRAMS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF SOUTH DAKOTA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE AND NATURAL RESOURCES  (SDANR) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. SDNAR  WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE BY 1) TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, 2) OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES OR OTHER MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES. 3) MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITY FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, 4) MECHANISM FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLAN AND VERIFICATION AND CERTIFICATION THAT CLEANUP IS COMPLETE.ACTIVITIES:SDNAR  WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE DURING THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.  WITH THE USE OF IIJA -128(A) FUNDS THE STATE WILL CONTINUE OUR EFFORTS TO ASSIST WITH THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF THESE 60 LOCATIONS ALREADY IDENTIFIED AS POTENTIAL BROWNFIELDS SITES.  STAFF WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE BROWNFIELDS ASSISTANCE TO SOME OF OUR MOST RURAL COMMUNITIES (LT;500) TO INCREASE TAX REVENUES AND REMOVE DILAPIDATED STRUCTURES THAT ARE A RISK TO THE YOUTH IN OUR COMMUNITIES, THUS PROVIDING AN ECONOMIC BOOST, GREENSPACES AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES TO THE COMMUNITY.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SDNAR WILL EXECUTE THE FOLLOWING TASKS:

 -	TASK 1 - COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT: A COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TEAM WILL LEAD OUTREACH. ENGAGED CITIZENS WILL HELP DETERMINE PRIORITY SITES AND REUSE OPTIONS. DANR WILL CONNECT WITH THE COMMUNITY THROUGH QUARTERLY MEETINGS, NEWSLETTERS, WEB SITES, AND SOCIAL MEDIA. DANR WILL ASSIST IN PREPARING A COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT PLAN AND PRESENTING INFORMATION AND GATHERING INPUT AT PUBLIC EVENTS.  ADDITIONAL RESOURCES WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY AND WORK WITH SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO ASSIST THEM WITH PLANNING, CONDUCTING AN INVENTORY AND WORKING TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY NEEDS FOR REDEVELOPMENT AS IT PERTAINS TO AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

-	TASK 2 - ASSESSMENTS: DANR WILL CONDUCT 10-20 PHASE I AND PHASE II ASSESSMENTS, WITH AN ESTIMATED COST RANGE FROM $4,000 TO $20,000 FOR EACH PROJECT LOCATION. WE EXPECT TO SPEND APPROXIMATELY $250,000 TO HAVE THESE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY QUALIFIED ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS FOLLOWING RECEIPT AND APPROVAL OF  QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPP).  DANR WILL ENSURE THAT ALL PHASE I AND PHASE II ACTIVITIES MEET ASTM STANDARDS AND COMPLY WITH THE ALL APPROPRIATE INQUIRIES FINAL RULE.
-	TASK 3 - CLEANUP/REMEDIATION: DANR WILL CONDUCT CLEANUP/REMEDIATION AT 10-20 SITES, AT AN ESTIMATED COST OF APPROXIMATELY $450,000.  THESE SITES HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THE ECONOMIC DISTRICTS IN TWELVE (12) DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES.  PREFERENCE WILL BE GIVEN TO THE SITES THAT ARE IDENTIFIED AS DISADVANTAGED, SHOVEL READY, AND WHERE A VIABLE RESPONSIBILITY PARTY HAS NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED OR THE PARTY REFUSES TO PERFORM

IMPROVED TRAVEL CAPACITY AND PERSONNEL SUPPORT WILL ALLOW FOR THE CONTINUED GATHERING OF BROWNFIELDS SITE INVENTORY, EDUCATION OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS, LOCATION OF ILLEGAL OPEN DUMPING SITES, AND ENFORCEMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE CODES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF SOUTH DAKOTA AG AND NAT RESOURCES (SDDANR) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. SDDANR WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE:  'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.' 
ACTIVITIES:SDDANR WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. GRANT FUNDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE USED TO ENHANCE SOUTH DAKOTA'S RESPONSE PROGRAM (SRP) TO CLEAN UP CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES TO REVITALIZE AND RETURN THE LAND BACK TO COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SDDANR WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THEIR STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, CONDUCT 5-10 PHASE I AND PHASE II ASSESSMENTS, AND AS FUNDING ALLOWS MAY PROVIDE CLEANUP FUNDING ASSISTANCE FOR SITES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. [CAR] WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION AND MAINTAIN RESPONSE READINESS, TRAIN TRIBAL STAFF, STAY ABREAST OF RESPONSE AND CLEANUP APPROACHES, AND PARTICIPATE ON EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS COMMITTEES.
ACTIVITIES:MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION AND TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE ENVIRONMENTAL INTEGRITY OF THE RESOURCES ON THE RESERVATION.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN'S TRIBAL BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO THE ENTIRE MENOMINEE COMMUNITY AND SPECIFICALLY PROVIDE UPDATES ON BROWNFIELD ACTIVITIES AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALS INCIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF  HO-CHUNK NATION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. HO-CHUNK NATION WILL PERFORM AN INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES, CONDUCT OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, DEVELOP MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLAN AND VERIFICATION AND CLEANUP CERTIFICATION, ENHANCE PUBLIC RECORD SYSTEM, AND CONTINUE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:HO-CHUNK NATION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT ALONG WITH REVIEW OF EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SOPS, POLICIES, CONDEMNATION CODES, AND HO-CHUNK NATION TRIBAL LAWS; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS BY REVIEWING INFORMATION TO DEVELOP PROCESSES FOR REPORTING COMPLETIONS; PUBLIC RECORD BEING MAINTAINED AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE AND CONTINUE ENHANCING THE TRP THROUGH THESE ACTIVITIES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:HO-CHUNK NATION WILL ENSURE THE NEEDS AND THREATS ARE IDENTIFIED THROUGH TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, INCREASE AWARENESS OF TRP ACTIVITIES AND INFORMATION SHARING TO ASSURE PROTECTION OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, BUILD SUPPORT WITHIN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH OPEN COMMUNICATION, IDENTIFY PROGRAM NEEDS FOR APPROVAL OF PLANS AND VERIFICATION AND CERTIFICATION OF CLEANUPS, AND BUILD CAPACITY AND INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF COPPER RIVER NATIVE ASSOCIATION (CRNA) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. CRNA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE COPPER VALLEY AREA.ACTIVITIES:CRNA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE COPPER VALLEY AREA.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CRNA PROGRAM HAS OUTLINED SEVERAL ANTICIPATED ENVIRONMENTAL IMPROVEMENT OUTCOMES FOR ITS PROGRAM AND SITE WORK. FIRSTLY, IT AIMS TO INCREASE COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF THE TRP PROGRAM AND BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGH COMPREHENSIVE OUTREACH EFFORTS. SECONDLY, THE PROGRAM SEEKS TO EDUCATE THE COMMUNITY ON PROPER HAZARDOUS WASTE AND MATERIALS MANAGEMENT AND DISPOSAL PRACTICES TO ENHANCE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. ADDITIONALLY, THE CRNA INTENDS TO EXPAND ITS BROWNFIELD SITES INVENTORY TO BETTER IDENTIFY AREAS IN NEED OF REVITALIZATION. MOREOVER, THE PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON IMPROVING ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH BY CONDUCTING THROUGH ASSESSMENTS AND REMOVAL OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES, LEADING TO BROWNFIELD SITE CLEANUPS. LASTLY, THE CRNA EMPHASIZE COMMUNITY HEALTH AND SAFETY, PLANNING TO CARRY OUT HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES AT TWO SITES TO CREATE A SAFER AND HEALTHIER LIVING ENVIRONMENT FOR THE COMMUNITY. THROUGH THESE INITIATIVES, THE CRNA STRIVES TO FOSTER SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT, PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT, AND ENHANCE THE WELL-BEING OF THE COMMUNITY.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE COEUR D'ALENE TRIBE WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE COEUR D'ALENE BROWNFIELD RESPONSE PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND ASSESS AND OVERSEE THE ASSESSMENT OF AT LEAST TWO SITES ON THE COEUR D'ALENE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF NAPAIMUTE'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF NAPAIMUTE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND QAPP PREPARATION. THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF NAPAIMUTE WILL BE HIRING A FIELD TECHNICIAN TO ASSIST WITH BROWNFIELD TASKS AND FIELD WORK IN REMOTE MINING SITES THAT IS PLANNED FOR SPRING/SUMMER 2024. THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF NAPAIMUTE WILL BE ASSESSING THESE REMOTE, ABANDONED MINING SITES TO DETERMINE THE POSSIBLE CONTAMINATION AND ENSURE THAT THEIR VILLAGE AND VILLAGES DOWNSTREAM AREN'T AFFECTED BY THE PERCEIVED LEGACY CONTAMINATION.ACTIVITIES:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF NAPAIMUTE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.

THE FUNDS FOR THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE USED TO PAY FOR THE COSTS IN THE SUPPORTING DOCUMENT LISTED AS APPENDIX A OF THE WORKPLAN. ALL COSTS ARE PASS THROUGH FUNDS AND THE USGS WILL RECEIVE REIMBURSEMENT FOR THEIR ACTUAL DIRECT OR APPROVED INDIRECT COSTS. 

STILLAGUAMISH CONTRIBUTION: $80,000
PRODUCTS: JOURNAL/USGS OPEN FILE REPORT AND USGS DATA RELEASE

BASELINE ASSESSMENT OF PAH CONCENTRATIONS IN FISH FROM THE STILLAGUAMISH RIVER, WASHINGTON
THE STILLAGUAMISH TRIBE PLANS TO USE THE INFORMATION GATHERED IN THE PAH BASELINE STUDY TO HELP DIRECT AND DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE AND MINIMAL-IMPACT FISH SAMPLING PLAN, TO BE USED IN A SPILL RESPONSE AND/OR CLEANUP (ELEMENT 4). ADDITIONALLY, UNDERSTANDING THE NATURAL BACKGROUND OF PAHS IN SALMON IS CRITICAL WHEN NATURAL RESOURCE DAMAGE ASSESSMENTS ARE CONDUCTED FOLLOWING A SPILL RESPONSE AND CLEANUP. CONDUCTING THIS BASELINE ASSESSMENT WILL HELP THE STILLAGUAMISH TRIBE UNDERSTAND THE CURRENT PAH CONTAMINATION OF SALMON, GUIDE FUTURE CLEANUP EFFORTS, AND PROTECT THE HEALTH AND CULTURE OF THE TRIBE. 

PROBLEM STATEMENT
POLYCYCLIC AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS (PAHS) ARE A CLASS OF OIL-DERIVED COMPOUNDS WIDELY DISTRIBUTED IN FRESH AND MARINE WATERS. THEY ARE OFTEN THE CHEMICAL COMPONENTS OF OIL THAT POSSESS THE MOST SIGNIFICANT TOXICITY RISK TO FISH. BECAUSE OF THEIR WIDESPREAD OCCURRENCE AND MANY SOURCES, BOTH COMBUSTED (I.E., CARS AND TRUCK EXHAUST) AND NON-COMBUSTED (I.E., CREOSOTE OR CRUDE OIL) RELEASES, IT CAN BE CHALLENGING TO PINPOINT THE SOURCE OF PAHS FOUND IN WILD FISH POPULATIONS AND WHETHER PAH EXPOSURE IS EVENT-RELATED OR CONSISTENT WITH BACKGROUND LEVELS. 

PROPOSED WORK
A BASELINE ASSESSMENT OF PAH STATUS IN WILD FISH THROUGHOUT THE STILLAGUAMISH WATERSHED AT THREE LOCATIONS: ESTUARY, LOWER-MAINSTEM, AND UPPER-MAINSTEM. BECAUSE TELEOST FISH READILY METABOLIZE PAHS, SAMPLES OF FISH BILE WILL BE ANALYZED FOR PAH METABOLITES AND COMPARED TO CONCENTRATIONS IN WATER (VIA PASSIVE SAMPLERS) AND NEARBY SEDIMENT. WE ADDITIONALLY WILL COMPARE PAH-METABOLITE CONCENTRATIONS AMONG RESIDENT AND ANADROMOUS FISH (E.G., JUVENILE COHO OR CHINOOK). AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF RELATIVE PAH CONTAMINATION AMONG FISH SPECIES WILL AID FUTURE SAMPLING EFFORTS BOTH IN THE STILLAGUAMISH AND REGIONALLY, POTENTIALLY HELPING TO REDUCE THE NEED TO SAMPLE ESA

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ASSOCIATION OF VILLAGE COUNCIL PRESIDENTS' (AVCP) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. AVCP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:AVCP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SECTION 128(A) TRP FUNDING WILL BE USED TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR A YUPIK SPEAKING BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM WITHIN AVCP, THE TRP WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE 56 NATIVE TRIBES THAT AVCP SERVES AND EDUCATION TO THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE NUMBER AND TYPE OF BROWNFIELD SITES WITHIN THIS AREA. THE AVCP VISION FOR THE TRP IS TO DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS WITH REGIONAL VILLAGE GOVERNMENTS TO REDUCE THE RISK OF THE PUBLIC'S EXPOSURE TO CONTAMINANTS FOUND IN BROWNFIELDS, AND TO ASSIST IN FULLY RECLAIMING SITES FOR REUSE. THE TRP AL AVCP WILL PRIORITIZE DEVELOPING RESOURCES AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE YUPIK LANGUAGE.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE GOAL FOR THE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP OF TRADITIONAL LANDS BY INTEGRATING CIV INTO THE INFRASTRUCTURE AND PROCESS OF CONTAMINATED SITES AND BROWNFIELD SITES MANAGEMENT.  

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL PRODUCE A SITE INVENTORY THAT WILL BE POSTED ON THE CIV WEBSITE.  THIS INVENTORY WILL BE INFORMED BY LITERATURE REVIEW AND COMMUNITY MEETING TO IDENTIFY SITES OF CONCERN TO CIV.  THE TRIBAL COUNCIL WILL THEN PRIORITIZE SITES TO ADDRESS SITES THEM IN SUBSEQUENT RESPONSE PROGRAM YEARS. CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL REVIEW 6 CONCEPTUAL SITE MODEL'S FOR CONTAMINATED SITES NEAR THE VILLAGE AND PREPARE MEMO WITH RECOMMENDATIONS. QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS GO TO ALL TRIBAL RESIDENTS OF KLUKWAN VIA EMAIL. RELEVANT FINDINGS AND UPDATES WILL BE INCLUDED. CHILKAT INDIAN VILLAGE WILL ESTABLISH PROCEDURE FOR TRIBAL REVIEW OF CONCEPTUAL SITE MODELS TO INFORM DETERMINATION OF IMPACTED SUBSISTENCE SPECIES AND PATHWAYS OF CONTAMINATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA'S) COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF TEXAS COMMISSION ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (TCEQ) WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENT QUALITY WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENT QUALITY VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS 7 ASSESSMENTS SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 1 CLEANUP PER YEAR.  

 ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2024; AND INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) ARE THE STATE AND REGULATED COMMUNITY. NO SUBRECIPIENT IN THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT GRANT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: 'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.
IN ADDITION, THE NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT WILL WORK WITH THE SMALL VILLAGE OF MAGDALENA, SOCORRO COUNTY, NEW MEXICO.  WITH THE GRANT FUNDS NMED WILL ENGAGE A PRIVATE CONTRACTOR TO CONDUCT COMMUNITY VISIONING FOR THE REDEVELOPMENT OF THE FORMER BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS (BIA) DORMITORY PROPERTY THAT HOUSED CHILDREN AGES 6-18 FROM THE ALAMO NAVAJO CHAPTER BETWEEN 1957 AND 1985.  THE DORMITORIES AND ASSOCIATED STRUCTURES HAVE BEEN VACANT SINCE 1986. LOCATED IN WEST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO, THE SMALL VILLAGE OF MAGDALENA HAS 806 RESIDENTS.  NESTLED AMONG MOUNTAINS, TRAILS, AND HISTORIC BUILDINGS AT AN ELEVATION OF 6,548 FEET, THE HISTORY OF THE AREA IS RICH WITH INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES, CATTLE DRIVES, PIONEER FAMILIES, AND MINERS.ACTIVITIES:NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES.

THE NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES SHOULD BE COMPLETED BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2024. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) ARE THE STATE AND COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY BROWNFIELDS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE COMPENSATION LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE COMPENSATION LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THIS NEW FUNDING WILL INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO PROVIDE PERFORM NECESSARY OUTREACH TO PROMOTE THE PROGRAM, ASSESS PREVIOUSLY IMPLEMENTED ENGINEERING AND INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS, CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUPS THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND PROVIDE PLANNING ACTIVITIES AND INVENTORY DEVELOPMENT FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES.  ACTIVITIES:THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: PLANNING ACTIVITIES, OUTREACH, AND INVENTORY DEVELOPMENT FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES, ASSESS PREVIOUSLY IMPLEMENTED ENGINEERING AND INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS, OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE STATE PROGRAM AND ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUPS THROUGHOUT THE STATE.SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING BROWNFIELD PLANNING ACTIVITIES, OUTREACH, AND BROWNFIELD INVENTORY DEVELOPMENT FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES (3 COMMUNITIES) AND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES.OUTCOMES:THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, PERFORM BOTH ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUPS THROUGHOUT THE STATE, PERFORM SITE INVENTORIES AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES FOR LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND ASSESS PREVIOUSLY IMPLEMENTED ENGINEERING AND INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS.  THEY WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO FUND PERSONNEL, AS A BENEFIT TO EMPLOYEES, AND PROVIDE COST WAIVERS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES ENTERING THE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM FOR SITE OVERSIGHT.  

ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES SHOULD BE COMPLETED BY DECEMBER 31, 2023. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES) ARE THE STATE AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY BROWNFIELDS.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE: BUILD GREATER PROGRAM EFFICIENCY, COMMUNITY PLANNING, AND TO EMPHASIZE ON ON ADDRESSING AND CLEAN-UP OF PUBLIC HEALTH HAZARDS, IDENTIFYING HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AND SUBSTANCES, AND CLIMATE CHANGE WITHIN OUR RESERVATION AND POPULATION THROUGH THE ENHANCEMENT OF OUR BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM. DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF RAIL ROAD COMMISSION OF TEXAS BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. TEXAS RAIL ROAD COMMISSION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ACTIVITIES:TEXAS RAIL ROAD COMMISSION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:TEXAS RAIL ROAD COMMISSION WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE TEXAS RAIL ROAD COMMISSION VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS 2 SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 1 SITE. OVERALL, THIS WILL BENEFIT THE CITIZENS IN THE STATE OF TEXAS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $ $783,614 TO NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY.  THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF NORTH CAROLINA. THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,192,434 TO SUPPORT THE ENHANCEMENT OF NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S (NCDEQ) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NCDEQ WILL SUPPORT THE OPERATION OF THE PROPERTY MANAGEMENT UNIT (PMU) IN ITS WORK ASSOCIATED WITH THE EVALUATION, PLANNING, MAINTENANCE, AND LONG-TERM MONITORING OF SITE-SPECIFIC INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS. EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:NCDEQ WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: IMPLEMENT AND MONITOR INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS THAT WERE PUT IN PLACE BY ACTIVITIES UNDER THE TRADITIONAL 128(A) GRANT THROUGH OPERATING THE PROPERTY MANAGEMENT UNIT (PMU). THE PMU'S ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EVALUATING COMPLIANCE WITH RECORDED BROWNFIELDS AGREEMENT LAND USE RESTRICTIONS, INSPECTIONS ON BROWNFIELDS PROPERTIES WITH RECORDED BROWNFIELDS AGREEMENTS, AND UPDATING THE DIGITAL PUBLIC RECORD.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THAT NCDEQ WILL EXPAND THE OPERATIONS OF THE PMU BY HAVING A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM FOR INSTITUTION CONTROL MONITORING, COMPLIANCE, AND STEWARDSHIP; PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH FOR BROWNFIELDS SITE OCCUPANTS/USERS; PROVIDE COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND ENFORCEMENT REGARDING LAND USE RESTRICTIONS; AND THE CONTINUED FACILITATION OF THE SAFE REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: THAT THE PMU WILL ALSO CONDUCT INSPECTIONS ON BROWNFIELDS PROPERTIES TO EVALUATE COMPLIANCE WITH RECORDED LAND USE RESTRICTIONS, INCLUDING THE REAL TIME EVALUATION OF SITE VOLATILE CONSTITUENTS OF CONCERN IN INDOOR AIR. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS IN THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $800,000 TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE ASSESSMENT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERLCA 128(A) IN THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. BROWNFIELDS ARE REAL PROPERTY, THE EXPANSION, DEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE OF WHICH MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OR POTENTIAL PRESENCE OF A HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, POLLUTANT, OR CONTAMINANT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE INVENTORY, CHARACTERIZE, ASSESS, CONDUCT CLEANUP PLANNING OF BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI AND COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS OVER 30 SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM AND OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES. ACTIVITIES:-SUBRECIPIENT:ISSUE AROUND $200,000 IN SUB-AWARDS ANNUALLY TO COMMUNITIES IN NEED (AS FUNDING ALLOWS). OUTCOMES:-

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $650,000 TO THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA). THE ACTIVITIES TO BE CONDUCTED INCLUDE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, ASSESSMENTS, CLEANUP PLANNING AND OTHER COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF KENTUCKY.ACTIVITIES:-SUBRECIPIENT:A LARGE PORTION OF THIS FUNDING WILL BE FOCUSED ON THE OUTREACH, EDUCATION AND ASSISTANCE NEEDED TO PREPARE COMMUNITIES IN THIS ENDEAVOR. WHILE THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET IS PLANNING TO FUND ONE POSITION TO STRICTLY PERFORM AND MANAGE BIL OUTREACH, MOST OF THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A SUBAWARD TO THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY THAT WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH KDEP TO HELP COMMUNITIES.

UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY- THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY COMMUNITY FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE OF KENTUCKY (CEDIK) WILL PROVIDE:
- A COMPREHENSIVE PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH CAMPAIGN (WITH EMPHASIS ON DISADVANTAGED, UNDERSERVED AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES)
- A MONTHLY WEBINAR SERIES FEATURING DIFFERENT ASPECTS OF BROWNFIELD REDEVELOPMENT INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO BASICS OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND PLANNING, DOWNTOWN REVITALIZATION, BROWNFIELD PROGRAMS, INVENTORY AND MAPPING TOOLS, COMMUNITY TEAMS AND PARTNERSHIPS, STAKEHOLDER AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT, COMMUNITY DECISION MAKING, DEVELOPMENT PRIORITY SETTING, FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES, WORKING WITH CONSULTANTS, AVAILABLE COMMUNITY DATA AND METRICS, MEASURING SUCCESS, REDEVELOPMENT PLANNING AND COMMUNITY VISIONING, CODE ENFORCEMENT AND ORDINANCE IMPLICATIONS, LAND REUSE AND REDEVELOPMENT, GRANT WRITING, COMMUNITY READINESS,
INNOVATIVE REUSE (CREATIVE PLACEMAKING AND CLIMATE RESILIENCY), SITE REMEDIATION, DAVIS BACON REQUIREMENTS, CATALYZING PROPERTIES WITH PURPOSE, HISTORIC DEVELOPMENT AND MAPPING RESOURCES, ETC. THIS WILL EVOLVE OVERTIME AS THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITIES CHANGE. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT AS MORE GRANT ARE AWARDED MORE GRANT MANAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL OFFERINGS WILL BE MADE. THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO CONTINUALLY ASSESS WHAT MAY BE MISSING AND WHAT PARTICIPANTS ARE STRUGGLING WITH.
- A BROWNFIELD COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM PROVIDING INTENSIVE COACHING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND FUNDING TO AN ANNUAL COHORT OF 7 DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. WE WILL TARGET AT LEAST 3 COMMUNITIES PER YEAR FOR THIS INTENSIVE ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE APPROVED TOOLS, SUCH AS THE CLIMATE AND ECONOMIC JUSTICE SCREEN TOOL TO HELP IDENTIFY TARGETS. WE WILL ALSO ASSESS WHERE THE PROGRAM HAS ALREADY SUPPLIED SERVICES AND LOOK TO TARGET NEW AREAS.OUTCOMES:-

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $521,297 TO THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (SCDHEC)'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. SCDHEC WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. SCDHEC WILL ALSO CONDUCT DIRECT ASSESSMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES (PHASE I AND PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS).ACTIVITIES:SCDHEC WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. SCDHEC WILL USE THIS GRANT TO ENHANCE ITS EXISTING STATE RESPONSE PROGRAMS,AND CONDUCT DIRECT SITE ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES USING THE SOUTH CAROLINA BROWNFIELDS ENVIRONMENTAL SITE TEST (BEST) PROGRAM. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SCDHEC WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THEIR VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS UP TO 40 SITES THROUGH THE BEST PROGRAM (ESTIMATED AT UP TO 40 PHASE I ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS, AND UP TO 27 PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS).

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $800,000 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT (CERCLA) SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE GRANTEE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES; OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; PROVIDING RESOURCES TO FACILITATE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT AND APPROVING ANY OTHER CLEANUP PLANS. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE GRANTEE INTENDS TO EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THEY WILL ALSO OVERSEE SEVERAL SITES THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THIS PROJECT. CITIZENS OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE ARE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,000 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (FDEP) TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THEIR BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. FDEP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES. THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE: TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION. FDEP WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND RE-USE PLANNING FOR THE TALLAVAST COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:FDEP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES FOR THE SMALL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANT: COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, BROWNFIELD TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND RE-USE PLANNING FOR THE TALLAVAST COMMUNITY. THIS WORK IS IN ADDITION TO THE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THE CERCLA 128(A) AGREEMENT WHICH INCLUDE: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FDEP WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE FDEP VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, AND PROVIDE DIRECT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO FACILITATE THE CLEANUP AND REUSE PLANNING FOR THE TALLAVAST COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $800,000 TO FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (FDEP) TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF FDEP BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. FDEP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:FDEP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES;  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
SUBRECIPIENT:THE FDEP PLANS TO FUND AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE INITIATIVE BY PARTNERING WITH THE FBA AND STATE UNIVERSITIES TO IDENTIFY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND PROVIDE TARGETED OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. IN RESPONSE TO THE FEDERAL JUSTICE40 INITIATIVE, THE FBA'S ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMITTEE HAS ESTABLISHED AN EJ40/67 SUBCOMMITTEE WITH THE GOAL OF IDENTIFYING A DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITY IN EACH OF THE 67 COUNTIES IN FLORIDA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A SUITE OF METHODS TO IDENTIFY THESE COMMUNITIES WITHIN EACH FDEP DISTRICT AND TO IDENTIFY FORMAL OR INFORMAL COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THAT MIGHT WISH TO RECEIVE TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT. FUTURE PHASES OF THIS PROJECT WILL SEEK TO DEVELOP RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, CONDUCT NEEDS-BASED ASSESSMENTS FOR BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE FOR EACH COMMUNITY, AND THEN DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (SUCH AS THROUGH A WEBSITE, IN-PERSON OR VIRTUAL WORKSHOPS, SITE VISITS, ETC.) AND TO EXPAND THIS EFFORT TO EVENTUALLY IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE ALL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THIS EFFORT WILL ALLOW FDEP TO IDENTIFY AND REACH NEW COMMUNITIES THAT ARE NOT FAMILIAR WITH THE PROGRAM AND PRIORITIZE ASSISTANCE TO THE HIGHEST NEED COMMUNITIES IN EACH COUNTY. FDEP INTENDS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS FOR THIS INITIATIVE TO ONE OR MORE UNIVERSITIES IN FLORIDA. FDEP AND SUBAWARD RECIPIENTS WILL COMPLY WITH EPA'S 'ESTABLISHING AND MANAGING SUBAWARDS' GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS AND EPA'S SUBAWARD POLICY. FDEP CONSIDERS THIS PROJECT AN ENHANCEMENT OF THE STATE'S INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES AND HAS BUDGETED AN ESTIMATE BASED ON PROJECTIONS FOR FY22/23.OUTCOMES:FDEP INTENDS TO UTILIZE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW GRANT MONIES TO FOCUS EFFORTS ON PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND ENHANCEMENT INCLUDING CONTRACT SUPPORT FOR ELIGIBILITY REVIEWS OF VOLUNTARY CLEANUP TAX CREDIT (VCTC) APPLICATIONS, COLLABORATING WITH VARIOUS UNIVERSITIES ON AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE INITIATIVE SUPPORTING THE FEDERAL JUSTICE40 INITIATIVE, AND CONDUCTING ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUPS AT BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. BIL FUNDS WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE, WORK WITH THE KEY ORGANIZATIONS WITHIN THOSE COMMUNITIES TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT THROUGH TARGETED OUTREACH EFFORTS AND PRIORITIZE TBA/SSA FUNDING IN THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITIES OF HIGHEST NEED. THIS EFFORT

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $60,000 TO SEMINOLE TRIBE OF FLORIDA FOR ITS RESPONSE PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE TRIBE WILL ALSO PURSUE MECHANISMS AND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION. LASTLY, SEMINOLE WILL WORK ON MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLAN AND VERIFICATION AND CERTIFICATION CLEANUP IS COMPLETE AT CONTAMINATED SITES. THE AWARD WILL ALSO BE USED FOR SITE SPECIFIC ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION WORK TO BE CONDUCTED AT AN ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELD PROPERTY. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE.ACTIVITIES:PUBLIC UPDATES ON THE SEMINOLE TRIBE OF FLORIDA'S WEBSITE AND WATER COMMISSION MEETINGS ON RESPONSE ACTIVITIES, COMPLETE ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS FOR PERSONNEL, TRAVEL TO CONFERENCES ON TOPICS RELEVANT TO RUNNING A RESPONSE PROGRAM, MONTHLY COMPLIANCE MONITORING ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATIONS, REVIEW AND APPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DEPARTMENT  AND TRIBAL PROGRAMS REQUIREMENTS (I.E. NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM, SECTION 404, SPILL PREVENT, CONTROL, AND COUNTERMEASURE), SITE SPECIFIC ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SEMIANNUAL AND ANNUAL REPORTS, LOGS FROM ALL WORK COMPLETED, CERTIFICATIONS FROM WORKSHOPS/CONFERENCES, COPY OF PUBLIC UPDATES ON RESPONSE ACTIVITIES, COPIES TRAINING CERTIFICATES FROM TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS, RESEARCH DOCUMENTS OR UPDATES TO TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL CODE/LAWS PAID FOR WITH THESE FUNDS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY OF THIS WORK WILL BE TRIBAL MEMBERS WHO LIVE AND WORK NEAR THESE SITES WERE RESPONSE ACTIVITIES TAKE PLACE AND WILL BENEFIT FROM A THE REMOVAL OF THREATS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF TULALIP TRIBES' BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. TULALIP TRIBES WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. CERCLA SECTION 128(A) ALSO AUTHORIZES ACTIVITIES BY THE RECIPIENT TO 'ASSIST SMALL COMMUNITIES, INDIAN TRIBES, RURAL AREAS, OR DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN CARRYING OUT ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) OF THIS TITLE WITH RESPECT TO BROWNFIELD SITES.' THE ACTIVITIES AUTHORIZED BY SECTION 9604(K)(7)(A) ARE:  'TO PROVIDE, TRAINING, RESEARCH, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS, AS APPROPRIATE, TO FACILITATE THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, REMEDIATION OF BROWNFIELD SITES, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, OR SITE PREPARATION.' THE TULALIP TRIBES' TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS LEGACY AND CURRENT THREATS TO TREATY RESERVED RESOURCES FROM CONTAMINATED SITES, ALONG WITH THE RESTORATION OF THOSE SITES TO SERVE OTHER FUNCTIONS.ACTIVITIES:
TULALIP TRIBES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT TULALIP TRIBES' LANDS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:
IN FY 23 (2022-2023), TULALIP TRIBES WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THEIR PROGRAMMATIC TASKS BY ADVANCING PROPOSED REGULATIONS FOR TULALIP GOVERNMENT UNDER ASSESSMENT AND CLEAN-UP. TULALIP TRIBES WILL DEVELOP A GENERAL PUBLIC OUTREACH STRATEGY AND CONTINUE TO UPDATE OUR INVENTORY AND PUBLIC RECORD. IN FY 23 (2022-2023), TULALIP TRIBES PLAN TO COMPLETE A PHASE 2 ASSESSMENT FOR THE ACE WESTERS SITE. DRAFT LANGUAGE FOR TULALIP TRIBES CHAPTER 8.20 WILL BE DEVELOPED THAT WILL GRANT AUTHORITY TO TULALIP NATURAL RESOURCES DEPT. FOR CERTAIN RCRA AND CERCLA PROVISIONS ON THE RESERVATION. THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEAN-UP STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE WILL BE FINALIZED TO ACCOMPANY THE PROPOSED CODE REVISION. TULALIP TRIBES WILL DRAFT A PUBLIC OUTREACH STRATEGY FOR THE TULALIP BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR TULALIP TRIBES RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAND RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENTAND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT TULALIP TRIBES LANDS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE TULALIP TRIBES RESPONSE PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES (PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES); OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; AND, MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND REDEVELOPMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF QAWALANGIN'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. QAWALANGIN WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.
ACTIVITIES:QAWALANGIN WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:QAWALANGIN WILL CONTINUE TO INVESTIGATE REPORTED SITES AND UPDATE THE SITE INVENTORY, PUBLIC RECORD, AND PRIORITIZED SITES LIST; COORDINATE WITH PARTNER AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO CONITNUE TO PROGRESS ON ADDRESSING BROWNFIELDS SITES; MEET WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND PROVIDE OUTREACH MATERIALS TO INFORM TRIBAL MEMBERS ABOUT THE PROGRAM, AS WELL AS PRESENT INFORMATION AT TRIBAL COUNCIL MEETINGS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. ACTIVITIES:NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA'S REUSE PLAN IS TO TURN THE SITES, AT MINIMUM, INTO GREEN SPACES SO THAT THE TRIBES CAN CONTINUE SAFE AND HEALTHY SUBSISTENCE PRACTICES UPON THEIR LANDS. THEIR LONG-TERM GOAL FOR THE HEINZ SITE IS TO RETURN IT TO ITS NATIVE STATE. THEY ALSO PLAN TO PURSUE NEW POTENTIAL BROWNFIELD SITES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:PRIORITIES FOR ELEMENT 1 INCLUDE SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS, MONITOR AND COORDINATE ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE ADEC ON THE HEINZ UNTIL THE ADEC DEEMS THE HEINZ SITE AS 'CLEAN UP COMPLETE' OR 'NO FURTHER ACTION REQUIRED', CONDUCT BROWNFIELD SURVEYS IN MENTASTA, SLANA, AND CHISTOCHINA, AND TO TAKE FURTHER ACTION ON THE BURNED DOWN TRAILER SITE, BLM/FIRE LOOKOUT SITE, AND THE MABLE CREEK SITE. GAKONA ALSO PLANS TO UTILIZE DRONE TO INVESTIGATE ANY NEW POTENTIAL CONTAMINATED SITES. THEIR PRIORITIES FOR ELEMENT 2 INCLUDE UPDATING AND MAINTAINING INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS TO CONTINUE THE EFFORTS OF THE CV-BTF, AND TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS ON A HAZARD MITIGATION GRANT. IF THEIR HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN IS DEVELOPED, THEY WILL RESEARCH FUNDING FOR EMERGENCY RESPONSE SUPPLIES. FOR ELEMENT 3, NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA WILL CONTINUE IMPLEMENTING INTERNAL MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, INCLUDING DEVELOPING VARIOUS OUTREACH MATERIALS, AND COORDINATION ACROSS PROGRAMS AND WITH AGENCIES. FOR ELEMENT 4, NATIVE VILLAGE OF GAKONA WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION ON ALL SITES WITHIN THEIR AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF FOND-DU-LAC TRIBE BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. FDL  WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S JURISDICTION.  SPECIFICALLY, FDL WILL ADDRESS THE CLEANUP OF THE WISCONSIN POINT SITE.  FDL WILL ALSO HIRE A BF SPECIALIST TO BUILD CAPACITY AND DEVELOP TRANSITION PLAN FOR THEIR PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:FOND-DU-LAC TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  ENHANCE TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT FDL'S JURISDICTION.  SPECIFICALLY, FDL WILL IMPLEMENT AND OVERSEE CLEANUP ACTIVITIES AT THE WISCONSIN POINT SITE.  FDL WILL ALSO HIRE BROWNFIELDS SPECIALIST TO TRAIN IN THEIR 128(A) TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, BUILDING CAPACITY FOR STAFF AND PREPARE FOR FUTURE TRANSITION OF STAFF.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FOND-DU-LAC TRIBE WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE TRIBAL RESPONSE AND VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS  SITES THROUGH THE TRIBAL TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF AT LEAST ONE SITE: WISCONSIN POINT.  BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE GRANTEE AS WELL THE FOND-DU-LAC TRIBE'S RESIDENTS THROUGH FUTURE CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT OF IDENTIFIED SITES.

THIS INCLUDES SUBSTANTIAL SITE-SPECIFIC WORK AND REGULATORY DEVELOPMENT WORK.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF WDNR'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. WDNR RR WILL OVERSEE AND MANAGE THE PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. IIJA FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO COMPLETE ACTION PLAN TASKS THAT SUPPORT THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES WITHIN WDNR'S STRATEGIC FRAMEWORK; ASSIST IN FOSTERING STALLED SITES THROUGH THE CLEANUP PROCESS.ACTIVITIES:WDNR WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE BY IDENTIFYING SITES WITH TCE CONTAMINATION IN THEIR CURRENT INVENTORY AS HIGH-PRIORITY SITES FOR MITIGATION/CLEANUP, AS WELL AS AUDIT SITES FOR COMPLIANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS; INCREASE OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITY BY EVALUATING POLICIES ON THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR LONG-TERM STEWARDSHIP OF VAPOR MITIGATION POST CASE CLOSURE; DE-PRIORITIZE LOW RISK PETROLEUM STALLED SITES; INCREASE OUTREACH TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS THROUGH OPEN-HOUSE MEETINGS AT REGIONAL DNR OFFICES; MAKE FUNCTIONAL AND CONTENT IMPROVEMENTS TO ITS WEBPAGES; SUPPORT STAFF HIRED USING PRIOR-YEAR BIL FUNDING TO AUDIT VAPOR INTRUSION SITES WHILE PROVIDING TECHNICAL OVERSIGHT AT COMPLEX SITES; ENHANCE PUBLIC RECORD BY IMPROVING THE SUBMITTALS TRACKING PROCESSES; SUPPORT STAFF HIRED USING PRIOR-YEAR BIL FUNDING TO ASSIST WITH TECHNICAL REVIEW SUPPORT OF EPA GRANT-FUNDED DELIVERABLES, DEVELOP TECHNICAL REFERENCES AND PROVIDE TRAINING ON COMPLEX SITES; LASTLY, WORK WITH WISC. HOUSING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY TO UNDERWRITE RLF LOANS TO PRIVATE ENTITIES.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:WDNR WILL IDENTIFY OPEN AND CLOSE NR 700 CASES WHERE TCE IS PRESENT TO REDUCE HUMAN HEALTH RISKS FROM TCE EXPOSURE, CREATE INVENTORY OF TCE SITES, ATTEND TRAINING CONFERENCES, PROVIDE EXPERTISE AND TRAINING TO OTHER STAFF/CONSULTANTS REGARDING COMPLEX SITES; EVALUATE POLICY ON RESPONSIBILITY OF VAPOR MITIGATION SYSTEMS POST-CLOSURE TO MITIGATE AND PREVENT INTRUSION RISKS, DEVELOP LONG-TERM STEWARDSHIP POLICIES FOR VAPOR INTRUSION; DEVELOP STRATEGY TO JUMP START WORK AT HIGH-RISK STALLED PETRO SITES AND DEVELOP ALTERNATIVE CLOSE-OUT STRATEGIES FOR LOW-RISK PETRO WHERE RESPONSIBLE PARTY REFUSES TO TAKE ACTION.

WDNR WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AT REGIONAL DNR LOCATIONS TO PREVENT FUTURE BROWNFIELDS, AND REDUCE GREENFIELD LOSS THROUGH FACILITATED BROWNFIELDS

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR KBIC'S PROGRAM ACTIVITIES FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUILDING CAPACITY IN THEIR BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM FOR GIS TRAINING THAT WILL HELP IN ASSISTING AND EXPANDING THE PROGRAM'S TECHNICIANS IN MAPPING TOOLS AND GEOSPATIAL CAPABILITIES. DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKLUTNA'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKLUTNA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.ACTIVITIES:NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKLUTNA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S TRADITIONAL LANDS.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKLUTNA WILL CONTINUE TO INVESTIGATE REPORTED SITES AND UPDATE THE SITE INVENTORY, PUBLIC RECORD, AND PRIORITIZED SITES LIST; COORDINATE WITH PARTNER AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS TO CONTINUE TO PROGRESS ON ADDRESSING BROWNFIELDS SITES; MEET WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND PROVIDE OUTREACH MATERIALS TO INFORM TRIBAL MEMBERS ABOUT THE PROGRAM, AS WELL AS PRESENT INFORMATION AT TRIBAL COUNCIL MEETINGS; REVIEW SITE CLOSURE RECOMMENDATIONS TO ENSURE PUBLIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL SAFETY.

THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS.ACTIVITIES:YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM (TRP) TEAM WILL CONTINUE TO REVISE AND ENHANCE THE SITE INVENTORY AS INFORMATION BECOMES AVAILABLE REGARDING CONTAMINATION CONFIRMED OR SUSPECTED, SITE INVESTIGATIONS CONDUCTED, AND REMOVAL ACTIONS CONDUCTED. THE YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TEAM COLLABORATES WITH ITS TECHNICAL SERVICES PROVIDER TO REVIEW SITE INVESTIGATION REPORTS AND CLEANUP ACTION REPORTS AND SELECT RELEVANT INFORMATION THAT SHOULD BE ADDED TO THE SITE INVENTORY. OUTPUTS WILL BE THE UPDATED AND ENHANCED SITE INVENTORY. THE TEAM WILL CONTINUE COMMUNICATING WITH TRIBAL COUNCIL AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT ENVIRONMENTAL TOPICS OF MUTUAL CONCERN AND COMMON INTEREST. THE TRP MANAGER WILL ARRANGE AND HOST PUBLIC OUTREACH EVENTS INCLUDING THE ANNUAL MEETING FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS. YAKUTAT TLINGIT TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO CATALOGUE DOCUMENTS RELATED TO SITE INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES AND ENTER THESE DOCUMENTS INTO THE REPOSITORY.
