THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION'S BROWNFIELDS TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM IS TO UNDERSTAND IMPACTS TO THEIR RESOURCES AND WORK TO PRESERVE, PROTECT, AND RESTORE CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE'S CUSTOMARY FISHING AND GATHERING AREAS. DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION'S LONG-TERM PROGRAM GOAL IS TO PROTECT THEIR SUBSISTENCE RESOURCES FROM IMPACTS CAUSED BY PAST AND POTENTIAL FUTURE MINING ACTIVITIES WITHIN OUR CUSTOMARY FISHING AND GATHERING AREAS, TO BE ABLE TO WORK WITH RELEVANT AGENCIES TO ASSURE THAT THE SUBSISTENCE HABITAT ENVIRONMENT IS PROTECTED TO THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT POSSIBLE, AND TO ASSURE THAT SACRED AND HISTORIC SITES ARE PROTECTED TO THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT POSSIBLE FROM ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS. DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION WILL ALSO FOCUS ON WORKING WITH AGENCIES, TRIBES AND TRANSBOUNDARY WORKGROUP ON CROSS-BORDER COOPERATION TO ASSURE CONTAMINATION FROM MINES ARE BEING ADDRESSED.ACTIVITIES:DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DOUGLAS INDIAN ASSOCIATION (DIA) TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM (TRP) WILL COMPILE A LIST OF THE MONITORING PLANS AND REPORTS RELATED TO THE KENSINGTON MINE AND GREENS CREEK MINE. DIA TRP WILL CONTINUE TO UPDATE AND ENHANCE THE DIA SITE INVENTORY. DIA TRP WILL CONDUCT OUTREACH TO INFORM COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT AREAS AND SITES OF CONCERN. THE DIA TRP TEAM WILL OBTAIN, AND REVIEW MONITORING DATA COMPILED FOR THE KENSINGTON AND GREENS CREEK MINES AND COMPARE THESE DATA WITH REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE MONITORING PLANS. DIA TRP TEAM WILL CONTINUE PARTICIPATING IN MEETINGS, WEBINARS AND WORKSHOPS THAT RELATE TO ONGOING WORK OR CURRENT ISSUES AFFECTING TRIBAL TERRITORIES AND REPORT BACK TO THE DIA COMMUNITY. DIA TRP TEAM WILL DEVELOP FACT SHEETS ON THE CAPITOL LANDFILL, TULSEQUAH CHIEF MINE, KENSINGTON MINE, AND GREENS CREEK MINE TO INFORM COMMUNITY MEMBERS ABOUT THE STATUS OF THESE FACILITIES AND OPERATIONS. THE DIA TRP TEAM WILL OBTAIN AND REVIEW MONITORING DATA FROM THE CAPITOL LANDFILL.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. ACTIVITIES:THE CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA TRIBES OF ALASKA WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THEIR VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, AND OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA'S BROWNFIELDS TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. TLINGIT AND HAIDA WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THEIR LANDS.ACTIVITIES:CENTRAL COUNCIL OF THE TLINGIT AND HAIDA INDIAN TRIBES OF ALASKA'S TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM AS IT ADDRESSES SECTION 128(A) IS DEVELOPING CAPACITY SO THAT TLINGIT AND HAIDA AND THE SOUTHEAST TRIBES ARE POSITIONED TO CATALOG AND INVENTORY CONTAMINATED SITES, IDENTIFY BROWNFIELDS SITES, DEVELOP A PUBLIC RECORD OF THESE SITES, INITIATE ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ENABLE US TO PRIORITIZE THEIR LEVEL OF TRIBAL CONCERN AND FACILITATE CLEANUP ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP TO REVITALIZE BROWNFIELDS WITHIN LOCAL COMMUNITIES. TLINGIT AND HAIDA COORDINATES AND COLLABORATES WITH TRIBAL, LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL ORGANIZATIONS/AGENCIES TO CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION, OUTREACH AND AWARENESS, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL TRAINING. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FOR THE UPCOMING 2022-23 PERIOD, TLINGIT AND HAIDA WILL PROCEED WITH UPDATING THEIR (POTENTIALLY) CONTAMINATED BROWNFIELD SITES DATABASE AND TRACKING SYSTEMS. TLINGIT AND HAIDA WILL BUILD ON INTERNAL COLLABORATION TO DEEPEN THEIR PROGRAMS UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROPERTY OVERSIGHT MECHANISMS AND AUTHORITIES USED BY THEIR PROPERTY MANAGEMENT AND BUSINESS ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DEPARTMENT. EXTERNALLY, THEIR PROGRAM WILL FOSTER NEW AND BUILD-UPON EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS THAT PROVE TO BE SUPPORTIVE IF AN OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITY SHOULD OCCUR. DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY FOR STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS, TO CAPITALIZE REVOLVING LOAN FUNDS (RLFS), AND SUPPORT INSURANCE MECHANISMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF MAKAH INDIAN TRIBE BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. MAKAH INDIAN TRIBE WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:MAKAH INDIAN TRIBE WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. MAKAH INDIAN TRIBE WILL CONTINUE THE LEGACY OF EXTREMELY SUCCESSFUL WORK IN THIS SPACE THROUGH CONTINUED MANAGEMENT OF AND COMMUNICATION ABOUT EXISTING BROWNFIELD SITES, EXPANDED PARTICIPATION IN RULE-MAKING, REGULATORY, AND POLICY-MAKING FORUMS AND DIALOGUES, AND INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF THE TRP AND MAKAH COMMUNITY TO PROTECT AND RESPOND TO THREATS TO ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY VIA ENGAGEMENT WITH FEDERAL AND TRANSBOUNDARY PARTNERS AS WELL AS ON THE LOCAL LEVEL.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: MAKAH TRP IS ESSENTIAL TO MAINTAIN AND GROW THE PROGRAMS OF THE OMA, INCLUDING PROVIDING FEDERAL AND STATE LEGISLATIVE REVIEW, DEVELOPING RULE MAKING AND POLICY RECOMMENDATIONS CONCERNING ENVIRONMENTAL AND TREATY RESOURCE PROTECTION TO THE MTC AND OUR FEDERAL, STATE AND INDUSTRY PARTNERS, AND SERVING AS A TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM ON MULTIPLE SCALES. THE WORK OF THE OMA TRP IS VITAL TO THE CONTINUED PROTECTION OF THE MAKAH LANDS, WATERS, AND RESOURCES UPON WHICH THE TRIBE RELIES AND HAS RELIED SINCE TIME IMMEMORIAL.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF  THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBE'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBES WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE FLATHEAD INDIAN RESERVATION. ACTIVITIES:THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBES WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE TRIBES WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH, CONDUCT CLEANUP AND REUSE PLANNING, AND WILL BUILD CAPACITY TO OPERATE A BROWNFIELDS OVERSIGHT PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBES WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBE'S VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE FLATHEAD INDIAN RESERVATION, DEVELOP AND ENFORCE SOLID WASTE CODES, IDENTIFY NEW BROWNFIELD SITES, AND PROVIDE VERIFICATION OF CLEANUP AT BROWNFIELD SITES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF MHA NATION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. MHA NATION WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE ENHANCEMENT OF PROGRAM SUPPLIES, ADDITIONAL TRAINING FOR PROGRAM STAFF, PARTICIPATION IN RELEVANT BROWNFIELDS CONFERENCES, AND CONDUCTING SITE ASSESSMENTS AND CLEANUPS.ACTIVITIES:MHA NATION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. THE FUNDS PROVIDED IN THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL BE USED TO ENHANCE PROGRAM CAPACITY THROUGH UPGRADED SUPPLIES AND PERSONNEL TRAINING, ALLOWING PERSONNEL TO ATTEND RELEVANT BROWNFIELDS CONFERENCES, AND ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF RESIDENTIAL SITES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MHA NATION WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE MHA NATION VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW MHA NATION TO OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF APPROXIMATELY 15 TO 20 RESIDENTIAL SITES CONTAMINATED WITH ASBESTOS, LEAD-BASED PAINT, AND METHAMPHETAMINE; ENHANCE THE PROGRAM THROUGH UPGRADES TO COMPUTERS AND SOFTWARE, AND SUPPORT PERSONNEL AND ENHANCE THE PROGRAM BY ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE INDIANA BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM INCLUDES THE FOUR ABOVE-REFERENCED ELEMENTS OF A RESPONSE PROGRAM AND MAINTAINS AND MAKES AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC A RECORD OF SITES ADDRESSED AND PROPOSED TO BE ADDRESSED BY THE RESPONSE PROGRAM.  

THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO ENSURE THE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELD SITES IN A STREAMLINED AND COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER, REQUIRING MINIMAL TECHNICAL OVERSIGHT, IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING A MECHANISM BY WHICH STAKEHOLDERS MAY BE ISSUED A DOCUMENT OUTLINING INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM)'S DETERMINATION THAT NO FURTHER RESPONSE ACTION IS REQUIRED AT A SITE. THIS GOAL WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT FOR SITE ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES. SECTION 128(A) GRANT FUNDING WILL BE USED TO COVER THE COSTS OF ACTIVITIES IN DIRECT SUPPORT OF BROWNFIELD SITES AS DEFINED UNDER CERCLA   101(39). ACTIVITIES FUNDED BY THE GRANT WILL INCLUDE TASKS RELATED TO PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT OF THE PROGRAM AND PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT ACTIVITIES TO MAINTAIN THE FOUR ELEMENTS OF AN ACCEPTABLE STATE RESPONSE PROGRAM, INCLUDING DEVELOPMENT AND PERIODIC UPDATE OF THE PUBLIC RECORD AND THE INVENTORY OF POTENTIAL BROWNFIELD SITES. SITE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND PERFORMING OVERSIGHT OF STATE AND FEDERALLY-FUNDED ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES AT BROWNFIELD SITES, IN ADDITION TO AWARDING 128(A) GRANT ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES TO COMPLETE SITE ASSESSMENT OR CLEANUP IN ORDER TO MAKE SITES READY FOR REDEVELOPMENT. THE PROGRAM ALSO ASSISTS WITH OUTREACH PERTAINING TO THE U.S. EPA BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM AND ITS FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES, IN ADDITION TO OUTREACH FOR THE PROGRAM.

ACTIVITIES:INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: CONDUCT OVERSIGHT OF ASSESSMENT, INVESTIGATION AND REMEDIATION ACTIVITIES AT ELIGIBLE BROWNFIELD SITES THAT RECEIVE ASSISTANCE THROUGH U.S. EPA AND/OR STATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, STATE LOANS OR COMFORT AND SITE STATUS LETTERS; CONDUCT OVERSIGHT IN REVIEW OF SITE INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP DOCUMENTS FOR PROGRAM SITES; SOLICIT PUBLIC INPUT REGARDING ANY U.S. EPA GRANT PROPOSALS IT SUBMITS, PROPOSED INCENTIVES USING FEDERAL FUNDING, OR CHANGES TO THE PROGRAM; ENCOURAGE COMMUNITY INPUT FOR PROJECTS, AND LOCAL SUPPORT FOR A PROJECT, INCLUDING NEIGHBORHOOD COMMENT/INPUT AND DEMONSTRATION OF A COORDINATED LOCAL EFFORT; AND REVIEW DOCUMENTS SUBMITTED FOR PROGRAM SITES TO ENSURE THAT THE NATURE AND EXTENT OF CONTAMINATION IS ADEQUATELY CHARACTERIZED, AS NECESSARY, AND THAT CLEANUP METHODS SELECTED ARE APPROPRIATE FOR THE SPECIFIC CONTAMINANTS AND MEDIA AFFECTED.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND OUTREACH OF THE IDEM VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM AND BROWNFIELDS IN GENERAL THROUGH NEWSLETTERS, A WEB PAGE, FACT SHEETS, CONFERENCES, AND PROJECT/COMMUNITY-SPECIFIC MEETINGS OR CALLS. IFA WILL ASSESS 3-5 SITES AND/OR CONDUCT 1-2 SITE CLEANUPS. I

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY'S (IFA) INDIANA BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM (IBP) THAT INCLUDES TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELDS SITES; THE ENHANCEMENT OF OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLANS; AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES.  ADDITIONALLY THEIR WORK INCLUDES THE MAINTENANCE OF THE PUBLIC RECORD, WHICH INCLUDES INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS.  THE IFA WILL ALSO PERFORM SITE ASSESSMENT AND SOME CLEANUP WORK ON BROWNFIELDS PROPERTIES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REDEVELOPING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
THE U.S. EPA IS SUPPLEMENTING THIS EXISTING COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR HENNEPIN COUNTY TO CONDUCT BROWNFIELDS REVOLVING LOAN FUND CLEANUP ACTIVITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.   THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS' (LRBOI) BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET AND ENHANCE THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. LRBOI WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING AND ASSESSMENT OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL RESERVATION AND TARGET AREA NORTHERN AREA OF LRBOI UNRECOGNIZED RESERVATIONS, BOUNDED AS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CENSUS TRACT 261010004.ACTIVITIES:LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES.  IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL RESERVATION TO ASSESS THE TARGET AREA PROPERTIES IDENTIFIED AS 'WAREHOUSE, DONTZ A, AND SUGAR SHACK.'SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LRBOI WILL ENHANCE THEIR 128(A) TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING AND ASSESSING HISTORICALLY POLLUTED BROWNFIELD SITES THROUGH PHASE I AND PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS. WITH FUNDING FROM IIJA, LRBOI WILL ALSO INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY IN MONITORING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGH EQUIPMENT DESIGNED TO BETTER EVALUATE AND ANALYZE CONDITIONS. LRBOI IS LOOKING TO MONITOR IMPACTS OF ASSESSMENT AND FUTURE CLEANUP WORK THROUGH THE PURCHASING OF A UAV AND DRONE.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.   THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF GRAND TRAVERSE BAND OF OTTAWA AND CHIPPEWA INDIANS' BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS BY FUNDING THE PURCHASE OF NEW FIELD EQUIPMENT AND PROVIDE TRAINING FOR STAFF.  OVERALL, THIS FUNDING WILL INCREASE THE GRANTEE'S ABILITY TO COLLECT DATA FOR SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR BETTER OUTREACH WITH GRAND TRAVERSE BAND MEMBERS.ACTIVITIES:GRAND TRAVERSE BAND OF OTTAWA AND CHIPPEWA INDIANA WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: PURCHASE NEW FIELD EQUIPMENT THAT WILL INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO SURVEY AND INVENTORY GRAND TRAVERSE BAND LANDS WHILE ALSO INCREASING THE EASE AND VOLUME OF COLLECTING DATA WHILE OUT IN THE FIELD; PROVIDE FORMAL GIS TRAINING FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF ALLOWING FOR USE OF ARCGIS SURVEY 123 ON THE NEW FIELD EQUIPMENT; AND FUND CONTRACTING PROFESSIONAL GIS WORK TO UPDATE GRAND TRAVERSE BAND'S EXISTING GIS SHAPEFILES TO MODERNIZE AND MAKE THEIR LAND DATABASE MORE USER FRIENDLY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ENHANCE CAPACITY TO FURTHER MEET EACH OF THE FOUR ELEMENTS OF GRAND TRAVERSE BAND'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE NOT DUPLICATED UNDER THE REGULAR APPROPRIATION CA. THE DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE:
1.	FIELD EQUIPMENT WILL BE USED TO BETTER GATHER INFORMATION (GPS POINTS, PHOTOS, ETC), TO BE USED WITH SURVEY 123, ON GTB PARCELS WHILE PERFORMING ANNUAL BROWNFIELD SURVEYS.
2.	THE NEW FIELD EQUIPMENT WILL ALLOW FOR BETTER INFORMATION SHARING BETWEEN DEPARTMENTS TO ENHANCE OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.
3.	ACTIVITIES PLANNED BY USING THESE FUNDS WILL ABLE GTB ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF TO BE PROPERLY TRAINED IN THE NEWEST VERSIONS OF GIS. THIS TRAINING, ALONG WITH THE IMPROVED INFORMATION GATHERING ON PROPERTIES, WILL ALLOW FOR AN INCREASE IN AND MORE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC OUTREACH. 
4.	EVERYTHING (FIELD EQUIPMENT, GIS TRAINING, AND CONTRACTING FOR UPDATED GIS SHAPEFILES) THAT THESE FUNDS WILL PROVIDE GRAND TRAVERSE BAND HAS POTENTIAL TO INCREASE THIS PROGRAMS CAPACITY AND MAKE CLEANUP PLANS/ACTIVITIES MORE FEASIBLE.

THE INDENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS FUNDING ARE THE GRAND TRAVERSE BAND'S STAFF AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF HO-CHUNK NATION'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. HO-CHUNK NATION WILL CONDUCT OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT, CREATE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS THAT PERTAIN TO BROWNFIELDS AND THE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF TRIBAL LANDS, TRAIN STAFF TO INCREASE THE SAFETY OF WORKERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS, AND WILL CONTINUE THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM (TRP).  ACTIVITIES:HO-CHUNK NATION WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES; DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE GIS GEODATABASE INVENTORY OF PROPERTIES WITH ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES ALONG WITH REVIEW OF EXISTING ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SOPS, POLICIES, CONDEMNATION CODES, HO-CHUNK NATION TRIBAL LAWS, AND CREATING NEW REGULATIONS; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; AND MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS BY ATTENDING TRAININGS, WORKSHOPS, AND CONFERENCES ON CLEAN-UP METHODS. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE AND CONTINUE ENHANCING THE TRP THROUGH THESE ACTIVITIES. 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:HO-CHUNK NATION WILL CONDUCT SITE VISITS TO INCREASE PRESENCE WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND ASSIST WITH THE INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, ENSURE THE TRP CAN RESPOND TO CONCERNS, COMPLAINTS, PROPOSED LAND USES, AND PRE-PROJECT ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEWS, BUILD SUPPORT WITHIN GOVERNMENT STRUCTURE TO PROTECT THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT AND THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS BY DEVELOPING AND ENFORCING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION LAWS AND ENSURE RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, ENHANCE MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF A CLEANUP PLAN AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES, AND BUILD CAPACITY WITH INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONTAMINANTS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ACTIVITIES:OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY WILL SUPPORT CLEANUP PROJECTS IN DISTRESSED/DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES- PRIMARILY PROJECTS FUNDED BY OHIO'S NEW BROWNFIELD REMEDIATION PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF DEVELOPMENT (ODOD).  THREE MAIN TASKS WILL BE FUNDED:  1) CONTRACT, PROGRAM, AND FISCAL MANAGEMENT FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDING TRACKING AND REPORTING OF MILESTONES AND OUTCOMES, 2) PROVIDING VOLUNTARY ACTION PROGRAM TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO OHIO DEPARTMENT OF DEVELOPMENT BROWNFIELD REMEDIATION PROJECTS, AND 3) SITE-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES (CONFIRMATION SAMPLING, PHASE I/II UPDATES, INSTITUTIONAL CONTROL PLANS, NO FURTHER ACTION  LETTER REPORTS)  USING TBA CONTRACTORS  FOR CLEANUP SUPPORT AT OHIO DEPARTMENT OF DEVELOPMENT REMEDIATION PROJECTS AND OTHER PROJECTS (INCLUDING ASSESSMENTS) IN DISTRESSED COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, AND COMPLETE 8-12 CLEANUP SUPPORT TARGETED BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT PROJECTS DURING THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD.  THE SPECIFIC SCOPE OF WORK IS EXPECTED TO VARY FOR EACH PROJECT DEPENDING ON THE GAP IN LOCAL GOVERNMENT MATCHING FUNDS AND PROJECT SPECIFIC TASKS. STAFF TIME FOR TBAS ALSO INCLUDES APPLICATION REVIEWS, COORDINATION, AND KICKOFF MEETINGS/SITE VISITS WITH APPLICANTS AND CONTRACTORS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS.  THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS.  THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF MICHIGAN'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS.  IN PARTICULAR, THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY'S EFFORT TO DIGITIZE BROWNFIELDS FILES AND REPORTS, SO THEY ARE MORE EASILY ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC.ACTIVITIES:MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: HIRE ADDITIONAL CONTRACTORS TO DIGITIZE BROWNFIELDS FILES AND REPORTS, CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL MEASURES, AND EXPAND THE PROGRAM TO INCLUDE OTHER AREAS OF THEIR REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT DIVISION THAT ARE CURRENTLY NOT BEING SERVED. BROWNFIELD FILES INCLUDING GRANT AND LOAN PROJECTS, ACT 381 WORK PLANS, PETROLEUM DETERMINATIONS, SUCCESS STORIES, AND OTHER DOCUMENTATION RELATED TO THE BROWNFIELD PROGRAM WILL BE SCANNED INTO CONTENT MANAGER WHICH HOUSES THE REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT DIVISIONS SITES OF CONTAMINATION DOCUMENTATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES AND ENERGY WILL CONVERT PAPER FILES AND REPORTS TO DIGITIZED FORM WHICH WILL EXPAND AND SIMPLIFY PUBLIC ACCESS TO BROWNFIELDS FILES AND REPORTS, INCLUDING TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF THE INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. THE INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:THE INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY WILL ASSESS 14-23 SITES AND OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF 4-9 SITES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WI BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WI WILL ENHANCE THEIR CAPACITY BY COMPLETING SURVEYS AND INVENTORIES OF BROWNFIELD SITES, CONDUCTING OVERSITE AND ENFORCEMENT, AND CONTINUING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM (TRP).  

ACTIVITIES:ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WI WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WITH THE VEHICLE THEY ARE PURCHASING: TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES; OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES THROUGH THE ENFORCEMENT PLAN IN PLACE; AND PRIORITIZE AND ASSESS SITES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN ACCESSING AREAS TO IDENTIFY AND ASSESS BROWNFIELDS SITES AND CONTINUE ENHANCING THE TRP THROUGH THESE ACTIVITIES.


SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ST. CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIANS OF WI WILL BE ABLE TO IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY OF WATER AND SOIL THROUGH IDENTIFICATION AND ASSESSMENT, PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM FURTHER EXPOSURE OF HAZARDOUS SITES, AND PLAN FOR CLEANUP, REMEDIATION, AND REUSE WHERE WARRANTED FOR BROWNFIELDS IN THE FORM OF GREEN SPACE, HOUSING, ENTERPRISE AREAS, OR FOR CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT PURPOSES TO IMPROVE THE ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH OF THE ST. CROIX COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS AND MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM. THEY WILL ALSO PERFORM OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; GAIN RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; ESTABLISH MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFY COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT ONEIDA RESERVATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: ONEIDA WILL ENHANCE THE 128(A) PROGRAM THROUGH HIRING A NEW STAFF MEMBER TO SUPPORT AND SUSTAIN ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE THROUGHOUT THE RESERVATION, IN ADDITION TO: ATTENDING 2023 TEPM AND TLEF CONFERENCES, FURTHERING THE FOUR, CURRENT 128(A) ELEMENTS, AND EXECUTING AN ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE ASSISTANT SUCCESSION PLAN.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF LAC DU FLAMBEAU'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. LAC DU FLAMBEAU WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITE IN LAC DU FLAMBEAU, WISCONSIN. THIS PROJECT ADVANCES THE DEVELOPMENT WORK, PROGRAM CAPACITY, EQUIPMENT, AND SITE SPECIFIC WORK. ALL WORK WILL BE COMPLETED WITHIN AN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITY AND CONSISTENT WITH THE TRIBE'S CLIMATE ADAPTATION PLANS.ACTIVITIES:LAC DU FLAMBEAU WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT TRIBAL LANDS OF LAC DU FLAMBEAU.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LAC DU FLAMBEAU WILL CONDUCT SITE SPECIFIC WORK, ESTABLISH AN INTERNSHIP POSITION TO ADDRESS ALL ASPECTS OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, CONDUCT POLLUTION PREVENTION ACTIVITIES (COMMUNITY HOUSEHOLD HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL CLEAN SWEEP), PREPARE AN ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GUIDANCE MANUAL, PURCHASE A FOUR WHEEL RESPONSE TRUCK FOR ACCESSING SITES, SPILL RESPONSE WORK, HAULING AND TRAILERING SPILL RESPONSE EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES, ACCESSING SITE FOR ONSITE PRESENCE VERIFICATION DURING ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP WORK; DRONE EQUIPMENT FOR SPILL RESPONSE; REMOTE CAMERAS FOR REPEAT DUMPSITES; AND ACQUISITION OF A VHS COMMUNICATION RADIO FOR COMMUNICATIONS AT SPILLS AND OTHER EMERGENCY EVENTS.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. ACTIVITIES:WDNR RR WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES ENHANCING THEIR RESPONSE PROGRAM BY: HIRING NEW STAFF TO EVALUATE CURRENT INVENTORY OF SITES IN BRRTS IDENTIFYING THOSE WITH TCE CONTAMINATION, WHICH WILL THEN BE UTILIZED TO IDENTIFY HIGH-PRIORITY SITES FOR MITIGATION/CLEANUP AS WELL AS SITES TO AUDIT FOR COMPLIANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL CONTROLS; INCREASE OVERSIGHT AUTHORITY BY STANDARDIZING STATEWIDE PROTOCOLS AND STANDARDS FOR REDEVELOPMENT PROJECTS ON SITES WITH HISTORICAL FILL; AND INCREASE OUTREACH TO LOCAL GOV'TS AND STAKEHOLDERS WHILE ALSO MAKING MAJOR IMPROVEMENTS TO ITS WEBPAGES. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES REMEDIATION AND REDEVELOPMENT PROGRAM WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND IMPROVE WEBSITE USER EXPERIENCE FOR CUSTOMERS, IMPROVE OVERSIGHT FOR COMPLEX SITES, IMPROVE CLARITY FOR CONSTRUCTION ON HISTORICAL FILL SITES, SEE TO STALLED PETROLEUM SITES ARE EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY CONDUCTING RESPONSE ACTIONS TO RESTORE THE ENVIRONMENT, REDUCE HUMAN HEALTH RISKS FROM TCE EXPOSURE, DEVELOP EFFICIENT PROCESSES FOR CLOSURE CONDITIONS, AND CONDUCT EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE EXTERNAL ADVISORY GROUPS.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF CONNECTICUT DEEP BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. CONNECTICUT DEEP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:CONNECTICUT DEEP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CONNECTICUT DEEP WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE CONNECTICUT DEEP VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, AND OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SITES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM GRANTS ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STATES, US TERRITORIES, AND TRIBAL NATIONS TO (1) ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE FOUR STATUTORY ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128(A)(2), (2) MAINTAIN AND UPDATE, AT LEAST ANNUALLY, A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES, PURSUANT TO CERCLA   128(B), THAT INCLUDES THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS HAVE BEEN COMPLETED DURING THE PREVIOUS YEAR AND THE NAME AND LOCATION OF SITES AT WHICH RESPONSE ACTIONS ARE PLANNED TO BE ADDRESSED IN THE NEXT YEAR, AND (3) CONDUCT A LIMITED NUMBER OF BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENTS OR CLEANUPS THAT WILL HELP ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE STATE OR TRIBAL NATION'S RESPONSE PROGRAM. MEDEP WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE...ACTIVITIES:MEDEP WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MEDEP WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE MEDEP VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO SMALL AND DISADVANTAGES COMMUNITIES, ASSESS MANY SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF SEVERAL SITES.

DESCRIPTION:EPA'S CERCLA SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS ACTIVITIES THAT ESTABLISH OR ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF STATE AND TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE ELEMENTS OF AN EFFECTIVE STATE OR TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AS SPECIFIED IN CERCLA SECTION 128, AND TO ENSURE THAT STATES AND TRIBES MAINTAIN A PUBLIC RECORD OF SITES INCLUDED IN THEIR PROGRAMS. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT ('IIJA') PROVIDED ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO CARRY OUT THE SECTION 128(A) GRANT PROGRAM.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT'S BROWNFIELDS RESPONSE PROGRAM TO MEET THE SECTION 128(A) ELEMENTS. RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT WILL OVERSEE AND PERFORM PLANNING, ASSESSMENT, AND CLEANUP OF BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND.ACTIVITIES:RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  TIMELY SURVEY AND INVENTORY OF BROWNFIELD SITES, WHICH ARE PROPERTIES WHOSE EXPANSION, REDEVELOPMENT, OR REUSE MAY BE COMPLICATED BY THE PRESENCE OF HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES. IT ALSO INCLUDES OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES TO ENSURE THAT RESPONSE ACTIONS PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT; MECHANISMS FOR APPROVAL OF CLEANUP PLANS, AND VERIFICATION OF COMPLETE RESPONSES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST IN REMEDIATING AND REUSING BROWNFIELDS SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF RHODE ISLAND. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT WILL EXPAND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH OF THE RHODE ISLAND VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, ASSESS TEN SITES THROUGH THE STATE TARGETED BROWNFIELD ASSESSMENT PROGRAM, OVERSEE THE CLEANUP UP FIVE SITES. THEY WILL COMPLETE FIVE SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, CLOSURE REPORTS FOR ALL SITES WORKED ON, SITE-SPECIFIC QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS FOR EACH SITE.
